content:
おんりょう〔怨霊〕
〈名〉Furies (of one's victim)

content.content: 怨霊に崇られる、怨霊に取りつかれる
to be haunted by furies of one's victim

content:
おんりょう〔温良〕
〈形〉Gentle; amiable

content.content: 性質極めて温良
She is of a very gentle disposition.

content:
おんわ〔温和〕
〈形〉Mild gentle, quiet, pacific (disposition); mild, clement (weather); mild, temperate (climate); moderate (views); mild, subdued (manners, etc.)

content.content: 彼は温和な性質だ
He is of a mild disposition―of a gentle disposition―of a pacific disposition.
日本は気候が温和だ
Japan has a mild climate―a temperate climate.
彼は温和な意見を懐いている
He holds moderate views.
これが温和派の意見である
These are the views of the moderate party―the moderates.
文明に進むと風俗が温和になる
Civilization subdues the manners of a people.

content:
おんわ〔穏和〕
〈形〉Moderate; temperate

content.content: 穏和派、穏和党
the moderate party―the moderates
穏和主義
moderatism―moderantism
穏和主義者
a moderatist―a moderantist―a moderate
穏和手段でいかなけりゃ強硬手段を用いるほかは無い
If it can not be done by persuasion, it must be done by force.

content:
か
〈接続詞〉Or; either... or...

content.content: これかあれか
(either) this or that.
君はフランス語かドイツ語か知っているか
Do you know either French or German?
雨か風かになる
It will either rain or blow.

content: 〈疑問接続詞〉If; whether... or...

content.content: 僕にできるかやってみよう
I will see if I can.
本当か嘘かわからん
I can't tell whether it is true or false.
本当かしら
I wonder if it can be true.
事実かどうか疑わしい
It is doubtful whether it is true or not.

content: 〈疑問詞〉［注意］邦語の疑問を表す「か」は英語にては主格と動詞の位置にて表す。例えば

content.content: そうです、そうですか
It is so―Is it so?
彼は行く、彼は行くか
He goes―Does he go?

content:
か〔可〕
〈形〉Right; good

content.content: これを為すは可
It is right to do it―You may do it.
日本は世界一の国なりというも可なり
One may say that Japan is the first land under the sun.
これを試みるも可ならん
I may as well try.
いずれにても可なり
Any one will do.
これを為すも可、為さぬも可
You may do it or omit it―It does not matter whether you do it or not.
可もなし不可もなし
It is neither good nor bad―middling―indifferent.
人の行動を可とする
to approve of one's action

content: 〈名〉(可否の可)aye

content.content: 可とするもの二百に対し否とする者は百五十
There are 200 ayes against 150 noes.
可とする者多数
The ayes have it.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=学校の何科)a course; a branch

content.content: 本科
the regular course
普通科
the general course
予科
the preparatory course
文学科
the literary course
随意科
an optional course
選科
an elective course
英語科
the English course
必須科
the compulsory branches

content: 2. (=大学の分科)a department; a faculty

content.content: (神学、法学、医学、文学の)四科
the four faculties

content: 3. (=兵科)an arm

content.content: 歩兵科
the infantry arm
騎兵科
the cavalry arm
砲兵科
the artillery arm

content: 4. (=博物学の界、門、網、目、科、属、種の科)(kingdom, phylum, class, order) family (genus and species)

か〔課〕
〈名〉A section

content.content: 局はいくつかの課に分かれている
A bureau is divided into a number of sections.
庶務課
the general affairs section
会計課
the accounts section
課長
the chief of a section

content:
か〔蚊〕
〈名〉The mosquito

content.content: 蚊が刺す、蚊が食う
Mosquitoes bite.
蚊に食われる
to be bitten by mosquitoes
蚊にせめられる
to be tormented by mosquitoes
蚊が鳴く
Mosquitoes buzz―Mosquitoes sing.
蚊の鳴くような声で言う
to speak in a thin voice
蚊のすねのよう
to be as thin as lath
この辺は蚊が多い
Mosquitoes are very bad here―The place swarms with mosquitoes.
蚊を追い払う
to fan off mosquitoes
蚊をいぶす
to smoke off mosquitoes―smoke out mosquitoes
蚊いぶし
a mosquito-fumigator―a smudge
マラリヤは蚊の媒介で伝染する
Malaria is spread by the mosquito.

content:
か〔香〕
〈名〉Smell; scent; perfume; odour; aroma

content.content: 花にはおのおのそれぞれの香がある
Each flower has it own aroma.
花は香を放つ
A flower emits a scent―gives out a perfume.
この花は好い香がする
This flower smells sweet―This flower has a sweet scent.
空気は馥郁たる花の香に満ちている
The air is redolent of flowers.
色と香
hue and scent

content:
か〔日〕
〈接尾詞〉Day

content.content: 今日は幾日か
What day of the month is this?―What is the date?
四月八日
It is the eighth of April―April 8th.

content:
が
〈接続詞〉
1. But; and yet; though; while

content.content: あの人は才は無いが何事にも成功する
Though he has no talent, he succeeds in everything―He has no talent, and yet he succeeds in everything.
才は無いが忍耐がある
He has no talent, but he has perseverance.
太郎は勉強だが次郎は怠ける
Jiro is idle, while Taro is diligent.

content: 2. And

content.content: この本を読んでみたが面白い
I have read the book, and find it interesting.

content: 〈省略構文〉

content.content: 金があったら貸して上げるのだが(無いから貸せぬ)
I would lend you the money if I had any.
そうだと好いが(そうでないから困る)
I wish it were so.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. In

content.content: 日本は人口が増す
Japan increases in population.
君は英語が上達した
You have improved in your English.
彼は学問が進んだ
He has progressed in his studies.
彼は英語が進んでいる
He is forward in English.
数学が後れている
He is backward in mathematics.
彼らは身体が健全だ、また精神が健全だ
They are sound in body and sound in mind.
日本人は戦争が上手だ
The Japanese are skilful in war.

content: 2. At

content.content: あの人は遊戯が上手だ
He is a good hand at all games.
計算が早い
He is quick at accounts.
速答がうまい
He is ready at repartee.

content: 3. Of

content.content: 日本人は合点が早い
The Japanese are quick of apprehension.
僕は呑込みが悪い
I am dull of comprehension.
彼は耳が遠い
He is hard of hearing.
足が早い
He is swift of foot.
背が低い
He is short of stature.

content: 4. For

content.content: 僕が行くことは不可能だ
It is impossible for me to go.

content: 5. On one's part

content.content: 彼があのようなことをしたからもう交際はできぬ
After such conduct on his part, our intercourse is at an end.

content:
が〔我〕
〈名〉Ego; egoism; egotism; selfishness; self-will

content.content: 我が強い
to be self-willed―opinionated
我を張る
to assert oneself―persist in one's opinion―persist in having one's own way
我を通す
to have one's will―have one's own way―gain one's end―carry one's point
彼は我を張り通した
He has persisted in his opinion to the last.
我を折る
to bend to another's will―give in―yield
彼はやっと我を折って宴会に出席した
He gave in at last, and attended the banquet.
子どもの我を折る(折らせる)
to break a boy's will―bend a boy to one's will
少年の我を折らなくては教育はできぬ
You must bend a boy to your will―break a boy's will―before you can educate him.

content:
が〔画〕
〈名〉A drawing; a painting; a picture

content.content: 貴方は何画をおかきになりますか
To what school of painting do you belong?―What do you paint?
西洋画です
I paint after the foreign school.
この画は誰の作か
By whom was this picture painted?
この画は雪舟の作だそうだ
This painting is ascribed to the brush of Sesshu.

content:
が〔駕〕
〈名〉A carriage

content.content: 駕を枉げる
to visit one―call on one
なにとぞ駕を枉げられんことを乞う
I beg you will honour me with your visit.
駕を迎える

content:
かい〔下位〕
〈名〉A low rank; a subordinate position

content.content: 下位に立つ

content:
かい〔会〕
〈名〉
1. (=会合)a meeting; an assembly; a gathering; a party

content.content: 会を催す、会を開く
to hold a meeting
会はいつ開くか
When is the meeting to be held?
毎月会がある
The meeting is held every month.
会を開く、会を閉じる
to open a meeting―close a meeting
会が散会する
A meeting breaks up.
会は十時に散会した
The meeting broke up at ten.
会に出席する
to attend a meeting―be present at a meeting
僕も会の末座に列した
I had the honour of being present at the meeting.
会で演説する
to speak before a meeting―address an assembly
講演会
a lecture meeting
議会
a deliberative assembly
懇親会
a social gathering
園遊会
a garden party
夜会
an evening party―a soir?e

content: 2. (=協会)a society; an association; a league; a club

content.content: 会を起こす、会を組織する
to form a society―organize an association―set a club going
会を維持する
to maintain a society―keep a club going
会に入る
to enter a society―join a society―associate oneself with a society
会を退く
to withdraw from a society
会に連なる
to be a member of the society
会の末席を汚している
I have the honour of being a member of the society.
愛国婦人会
the Ladies' Patriotic League
動物虐待防止会
a society for the prevention of cruelty to animals (S. P. C. A―と略す)

かい〔解〕
〈名〉Explanation; solution:(教科書などの解は)a key

content.content: この教科書に解があるか

問題には一々解が付いている
Each problem has a solution to it.

content:

〈接尾名詞〉A time:(遊戯の一回)a game:(相撲などの一回)a bout:(競走の一回)a heat

content.content: 一回
once
二回
twice
三回
thrice―three times
四回、五回
four times―five times
会は月に一回開く
The meeting is held once a month.
第一回の会

三回勝負
a match of three games―(トランプなら)―a rubber of whist

〈名〉Pleasure; enjoyment

content.content: 快を尽す

to enjoy life

I have enjoyed myself to the full.

It is an unspeakable pleasure.

content.content: 洞窟の怪

〈接尾名詞〉A sea; waters

content.content: 日本海
the Sea of Japan

The squadron is now in Chinese waters.

かい〔界〕
〈接尾名詞〉World; circles:(博物の何々界)kingdom

content.content: 政界
the political world―politics
実業界
the business circles
文学界
the literary world―the republic of letters―the commonwealth of letters

the military circles
外交界
the diplomatic circles
経済界
the financial world―the financial circles
法曹界
the legal world

the official circles
新聞界
the press
動物界、植物界、鉱物界
the animal kingdom―the vegetable kingdom―the mineral kingdom

content:
かい〔階〕
〈接尾名詞〉
1. (=家の階)a story:(英国にては)a floor

content.content: 二階
(英国にては)the first floor―(米国にては)―the second story
二階に居る
He is upstairs.
二階下に居る
He is downstairs.
僕は三階住居だ
I live on the third story―(英国にては)―on the second floor―(いずれにても)―up two pair of stairs.
二階家
a two-storied house
三階建て
a three-storied house

content: 2. (=位の階)a grade

content.content: 位一階を進めらる

content:
かい〔貝〕
〈名〉A shell; a shell-fish

content.content: 海岸で貝を拾う
to gather shells on the seashore
貝類学
conchology
貝類学者
a conchologist

content:
かい〔甲斐〕
〈名〉
1. Worth

content.content: かいあり
to be worth doing something―worth while to do something―to do something to some purpose
この本は読みがいがある
The book is worth reading―It is worth while to read the book.
骨折りがいがあった
I have laboured to some purpose―I have not laboured in vain―It was worth the trouble―My labours are crowned with success.
富士登山は骨折りがいがある
The ascent of Mt. Fuji is well worth the trouble.
この研究は研究しがいがある
The study is worth it.
この獲物なら争いがいがある
The prize is worth contending for.
自由の為なら死にがいがある
Liberty is worth dying for.
そんな生活なら生きがいがある
It is a life worth living.
今度成功するなら生まれたかいがある
If I succeed this time, I shall have been born to some purpose.
かい無し
It is not worth doing―unavailing―of no avail―to do something in vain―to no purpose―to no effect―to no avail―without avail―without effect―without success.
いくたび試みてもそのかい無し
I have tried several times in vain―to no purpose―without success.
骨折りがいが無い
I have laboured in vain―laboured to no purpose―It was not worth the trouble.
あれは世話しがいの無い男だ
He is not worth helping.
生きがいの無い命だ
It is a life not worth living.
住みがいの無い世だと思った
I felt it was a world not worth living in.
せっかくの努力もそのかい無し
All my efforts were in vain―of no avail―unavailing―All my efforts availed me nothing.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 待つかいあって(逢うことができたなど)
My patience is rewarded.
忍耐すればきっと忍耐しただけのかいがある
Perseverance is sure of its reward―Perseverance will not fail of its reward.
彼は勉強したかいがあって今では級の首席を占めている
Owing to his diligence, he is now at the top of his class.
恩を知らぬ者には親切の尽しがいが無い
Kindness is thrown away upon ungrateful people.
年がいも無いことをするじゃないか
It is beneath your years to do such a thing―You should know better at your age.
試みてもそのかいが無いから止せ
It is no use trying―no good trying.
あの人には勧めがいが無い
It is no use trying to persuade that man.
あれは頼みがいの無い男だ
He is not to be relied upon―unreliable.
あのような友人は頼みがいが無い
He is a fair-weather friend―Such a friend will fall you in time of need.
友達がいに
for friendship's sake

〈名〉An oar; a scull:(canoe のは)a paddle

content.content: かいで舟をこぐ
to row a boat (with an oar)
かいをこぐ
to pull an oar
かいを揃えてこぐ
to keep stroke
かいが揃う、揃わぬ
The rowers keep stroke―do not keep stroke.
かいをかい架けに乗せる
to ship an oar
かいをかい架けからはずす
to unship an oar
かいをかい架けからはずして流す
to trail an oar
(こぐときに)かいをはずしてひっくりかえる
to catch a crab
かいを水に浸す
to dip the oar in the water
かいを水から上げて水平にする
to feather an oar
かいを立てる
to toss oars

content:
かい〔隗〕
〈名〉

content.content: 乞う隗より始めよ
Begin with No. 1.

content:
がい〔我意〕
〈名〉Self-will

content.content: 我意が強い
to be self-willed―opinionated
我意を張る
to persist in one's opinion
我意を通す
to have one's will―have one's own way―gain one's end―carry one's point

content:
がい〔外〕
〈前置詞相当〉Out of; without; outside

content.content: 屋外で運動する
to take exercise out of doors
屋外遊戯
outdoor sports
北京城の内外
within and without the walls of Peking
北京城外
outside the walls of Peking
市外

それは中学課程の範囲外だ
It is outside the limits of the middle-school curriculum.

content:
がい〔害〕
〈名〉
1. Harm; hurt; injury; wrong; damage; mischief; detriment; prejudice; bane; ill effects:(=する) to harm (one's interests); to hurt (one's feelings); to injure, wrong (a man); to impair (one's health); to damage, do damage to (the crops); to spoil (one's beauty); to corrupt (one's morals); to do mischief to (one's constitution); to be injurious to (one's health); to be detrimental to (health); to be prejudicial to (one's interests); to be destructive to (public morals); to play the devil with, play the mischief with, play havoc with (one's constitution, etc.):(=ある) bad (for the health); hurtful (to the eye); harmful (to the crops); injurious (to health); prejudicial (to one's interests); derogatory (to one's character); destructive (to or of public morals); fatal (to art); ruinous (to the state); noxious (plants or insects); malignant (genius); deleterious (influence); baneful (superstition); baleful (night-air, etc.):(=なき) harmless (amusement); innoxious (plants or insects); innocuous (snake)

content.content: 健康を害す
to injure one's health―impair one's health―ruin one's health
彼は健康を害している
He is in ill health―out of health.
人の感情を害す
to hurt one's feelings―wound one's pride
彼は感情を害している
He feels hurt―He is hurt―His pride is wounded.
人の名誉を害す
to injure one's reputation
人の名誉を害するようなことを言うものでない
You should not say things which are injurious to people's reputation.
人の利益を害す
to harm one's interests
そんな条約をされては日本の利益を害す
Such a treaty would be prejudicial to Japan's interests.
人を害す
to injure a man―wrong a man―kill a man
(人から)害をこうむる
to suffer wrong―suffer injuries
農作物を害す
to harm the crops―do harm to the crops―damage the crops―do damage to the crops―do mischief to the crops
風景を害す
to impair the beauty of the scenery―spoil the scenery
風儀を害す
to corrupt one's morals
風教を害す
to corrupt the public morals―be injurious to public morals―be destructive to public morals
風紀を害す
to be injurious to discipline
平和を害す
to be prejudicial to peace
安寧を害す
to disturb the public peace
敵に害を加える
to inflict damage upon the enemy
彼は放蕩をしてひどく身体を害した
Riotous life has played the devil with his constitution―played the deuce with his constitution―played the mischief with his constitution.
悪い食物が胃を害す
Bad food plays havoc with one's digestion.
害になる
to do one harm
酒は身体の害になる
Wine will do you harm.
小量の酒は害にはならぬ、かえって薬だ
A little wine will do you no harm―do you more good than harm.
酒の害
the effects of drinking
君が干渉すると益にはならぬ、かえって害になる(有害無益)
You interference will do no good―do more harm than good.
金は芸術の害になる
Gold is fatal to art.
こんな本は風教の害になる
Such books are injurious to public morals―destructive to public morals.
北風は農作物の害になる
The north wind is harmful to the crops.
健康に害あり、衛生に害あり
It is bad for the health―injurious to health―detrimental to health―destructive of health.
酒と煙草は養生に害あり
Wine and tobacco are bad for the health―injurious to health.
衛生に害ある職業
an unhealthful occupation
衛生に害ある食物
unwholesome food
衛生に害ある空気
unsalubrious air

content: 2. (=Good に対し)evil

content.content: 一利あれば一害あり(一利一害)
Where there is good, there is evil.
金は世を益する力ともなりまた世を害する力ともなる
Money may be a power for good or a power for evil.

content: 3. (=災害)a pest; a plague

content.content: オーストラリアの兎害
the rabbit pest of Australia
蠅害
a fly pest―a plague of flies

content:
がい〔概〕
〈名〉Appearance

content.content: 艨艟大海を圧するの概あり
How they seem to lord it over the deep!
彼は古武士の概あり
He reminds you of an old-time samurai―He is suggestive of an old-time samurai.
酸素療法は万能の概あり
Oxypathy gives one the idea of being all-powerful.

content:
がい〔該〕
〈指摘形容詞〉(The) said

content.content: しこうして該費用は関係者の負担たるべし

content:
かいあおる〔買煽る〕
〈自動〉To rig the market; to boom the market; to bull; to peg

content.content: 軽気連が買いあおる
The bulls boom the market.

かいあく〔改悪〕

Briefly stated―To sum up―To be short―In short―To be brief―In brief―In a word―in sum―in substance.

Briefly stated, it is this―To sum up, it is this―In a word, it is this―The long and short of it is this.

He is the handsomest man in the whole neighbourhood.
その医者は界隈に有名だ
The doctor is known for miles around.

content:
かいわん〔怪腕〕
〈名〉Shrewdness:(=の) shrewd

content.content: あの男は怪腕だ
He is a shrewd fellow.

かいわん〔海湾〕
〈名〉A bay; a gulf

かいん〔下院〕
〈名〉The lower house; the lower chamber:(日本は)the House of Representatives:(英国は)the House of Commons:(仏国は)the Chamber of Deputies:(米国は)the congress

content:
かう〔支う〕
〈他動〉To prop up; to support (anything) with a prop

content.content: 松の枝に棒をかう
to support a pine-bough with a prop

content:
かう〔飼う〕
〈他動〉To keep (a horse); to raise (cattle); to rear (game, etc.)

content.content: 犬や猫や馬を飼う
to keep a dog―keep a cat―keep a horse
豚を飼う
to keep swine―raise pigs
牛を飼う
to keep cows―raise cattle―breed cattle
蚕を飼う
to raise silkworms―rear silkworms

content:
かう〔買う〕
〈他動〉
1. To buy; to purchase

content.content: 馬を買った
I have bought a horse―(自分用の意味を表わすには)―bought myself a horse.
お前には自転車を買ってやろう
I will buy you a bicycle.
花をお買いになりませんか
Won't you buy some flowers?
この馬を百円に買った
I bought my horse for 100 yen―(と言うよりも普通は)―I gave 100 yen for my horse.
君の家はいくらに買ったか
What did you give for your house?
もう少し買って下されば売ります
I will sell it if you will give me a little more.
百円に買って下さい
Give me 100 yen for it.
じゃもう五円買ってやろう
Then I will give you five yen more for it.
二人で品物を皆買おうじゃないか
Let us buy up the goods between us.
君はこの家を誰から買ったか
From whom―of whom―did you buy your house?
僕はいつもあの店で買う
I always buy at that shop.
金で買う
to buy anything with money
金で買われぬものもある
Money can not buy all things.
金で幸福は買われぬ
Money can not buy happiness.
快楽は苦痛をもって買う
Pleasure is bought at the price of pain.
本を買う金
money with which to buy a book―money to buy a book with
本を買う金が欲しい
I want some money to buy a book with.
僕は外套が欲しいが買う金が無い
I want an overcoat, but I have no money to buy one with.
長靴が欲しいが買う金が無い
I want long boots, but I have no money to buy a pair with.
安く買う
to buy anything cheap―buy anything at a low price―buy anything at a bargain―make a good bargain
安く買って高く売る
They buy cheap and sell dear.
この馬は安く買った
This horse was a good bargain―I had a good bargain in this horse.
高く買う
to buy anything dear―buy anything at a high price―make a bad bargain
本物ならいくら高くとも買う
I will buy a genuine article at any price―I will give any price for a genuine article.
掛けで買う
to buy anything on credit―go on tick for anything
僕は何でも現金で買う
I pay cash for everything.
現金で買うから負けろ
If I pay cash down, you will reduce the price.
僕は何でも言い値に買う
I give the price asked for everything.
言い値に買おう
I will take it at your price―Name your price, and you shall have it.
捨て値に買う
to buy anything for a mere song
新{あら}で買う
to buy anything new
古手で買う
to buy anything second-hand
月賦で買う
to buy anything by payment
春を買う
to buy a woman's favours―buy favours of a woman

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 鉱山を買う(投資する)
to invest one's capital in―sink one's capital in―a mine
彼は身なりを直そうと思って金縁の眼鏡を奮発して買った
In order to improve his appearance, he invested in―treated himself to―a pair of gold-rimmed spectacles.
彼は月給を貰うと皆本を買ってしまう
He spends all his money on books.
精々勉強致しますからどうぞお買い下さい
We try to sell as cheap as we can, so you will give us your custom.
買わぬかと言う
to offer for sale
彼は家を買わぬかと言った
He offered me a house for sale.
その家を五千円に買おうと言った
I offered him 5,000 yen for the house.
この本は学生にも買えるか
Is the book within the reach of the student?
この価では学生には買えぬ
The price is beyond the reach of the student.
女郎を買う
to hire a prostitute (for a night)―(平生なら)―frequent the company of prostitutes―womanize
芸者を買う
to hire a geisha to do bedservice―(平生なら)―frequent the company of geisha
(女が)役者を買う
A woman buys an actor's love―(平生なら)―frequents the company of actors.
飲む買う打つの三拍子揃った道楽者だ
He is addicted to wine, woman and dice―a votary of Bacchus, Venus and Fortune.
けんかを買う
to take up a quarrel
そのけんかは俺が買った
I will take up that quarrel.
なにも人のけんかを買うにも及ぶまい
Why should I make another's quarrel my own?
歓心を買う
to seek one's favour―win one's favour―insinuate oneself into another's favour―ingratiate oneself with one
彼は主人の歓心を買うために勉強した
He worked hard to win his master's favour.
人に媚びて歓心を買う
to curry favour with one

content: 6. (=招く)to incur (one's displeasure)

content.content: 恨みを買う
to incur one's enmity―give offence
あの人の恨みを買った覚えは無い
I am not conscious of having given him offence.
事実を言ってあの人の怒りを買った
I incurred his displeasure by speaking the truth.

content: 7. (=値を踏む)to estimate; to rate

content.content: 人を高く買う
to overrate―overestimate―a man
人を安く買う
to underrate―underestimate―a man
彼を実価に買おう
I will estimate him at his true value―take him as he is.
言い値に買おう
I will take him at his own price.

content: 8. (=認める)to appreciate, do justice to (one's merits)

content.content: 彼の親切を買ってやらねばなるまい
I can not but appreciate his kindness.
彼は君の親切を充分に買っている
He shows due appreciation of your kindness.
彼の価値は十分に買ってやる
I will do full justice to his merits.
その点は買っておる
I will do justice to that point of yours.
彼の義侠心を一番買ってやらずばなるまい
His chivalrous spirit challenges our admiration.

content:
かうん〔家運〕
〈名〉One's fortunes

content.content: 家運すでに傾く
His fortunes are on the decline.
家運を挽回する
to retrieve one's fortunes

content:
かえ〔替え〕
〈前置詞相当〉At

content.content: 一ダース三円替え
It is sold at three yen per dozen.

かえうた〔替え歌〕
〈名〉A parody; a burlesque

かえうま〔替え馬〕
〈名〉A spare horse; a remount:(途中に備えあれば)a relay horse

かえし〔返し〕
〈名〉
1. (=返礼)anything given in return for a present
2. (=返歌)an answering couplet
3. (=つり銭)change

content:
かえす〔反す〕
〈他動〉To turn; to overturn; to upset; to turn (anything) upside down; to turn (anything) inside out

content.content: たもとをかえす
to turn one's pocket inside out
掌{たなごころ}をかえすが如し
It is like turning your hand―no trouble at all.
掌をかえす間も無く
before you can say Jack Robinson
汗をかえす
to go back on one's word―countermand

content:
かえす〔返す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=返却する)to return (one anything); to repay (a debt); to pay (one a debt); to restore (anything to its owner)

content.content: 借りた物を返す
to return one a borrowed article
本が明いたら返してくれ給え
Please return me the book if you have done with it.
借金を返す
to pay one a debt―repay a debt
借金を返さなければならぬ
I must pay my debt―pay my dues―get square with my creditors―improve my face.
借金をだんだん返す
to work off one's debts
借りた物を返すのは当然だ
One ought to pay what one owes.
彼は僕にぜひ金を返せと言ってきかぬ
He insists on my paying him the money.
金を返さぬなら訴えます
If you will not pay me, I will bring an action against you.
金を返すのはご都合でよろしい
You may pay me at your own convenience―take your own time for payment.
金はいつでも返す
I am ready to pay you.
預かり物は当然その主に返すべきものだ
What one holds in trust, ought to be restored to its owner.
拾い物を落とし主に返す
to restore lost property to its owner
言葉を返す
to reply―rejoin
返す言葉が無かった
I did not know what to say in reply.
借りる時の地蔵顔、返す時の閻魔顔
“An angle in borrowing, a devil in repaying.”

content: 2. (=返報する)to repay (a kindness); to requite (a favour); to revenge (one's wrongs); to avenge (one's father's wrongs)

content.content: 恩を返す
to repay one's kindness―requite one's favour
仇を返す
to revenge one's wrongs―(を通例略して)―avenge one―revenge oneself―be revenged―(on one's enemy)
仇を恩で返す
to return good for evil
恩を仇で返す
to return evil for good

content: 3. (=送り返す)to send back

content.content: 嫁を親元へ返す
to send back a bride to her parents
(仕立屋などが)仕事を返される
A tailor has his work returned on his hands.

content: 4. (=元へ返す)to put back; restore

content.content: 元のところへ返しておけ
Put it back―Restore it to its former place―Leave it where you found it.

content:
かえす〔孵す〕
〈他動〉To hatch, incubate (eggs); to hatch out (chickens)

content.content: 鶏の卵をかえすに二十一日かかる
It takes three weeks to hatch hen's eggs.
牝鶏が卵をかえしている
The hen is sitting (on eggs)―brooding―incubating.
牝鶏が雛を十羽かえした
Our hen has hatched out a brood of ten.

content:
かえすがえすも〔返す返すも〕
〈副〉Repeatedly; again and again; over and over again

content.content: かえすがえすも言い聞かした
I told him over and over again.
今度失敗したのがかえすがえすも残念だ
The failure is never enough to be regretted.

content:
かえだす〔渫え出す〕
〈他動〉To bail out; to pump ship

content.content: 船アカをかえ出す
to bail the water out―bail out the boat

content:
かえだま〔替玉〕
〈名〉A fraudulent substitute

content.content: 替玉を使う
to smuggle a substitute
替玉を使って入学試験を受ける
to send a substitute to an examination
替玉になって入学試験を受ける
to attend an examination as substitute
女の子を男の子に仕立てて替玉に使った
They put a girl upon me as a boy.

content:
かえって〔却って〕
〈副〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. On the contrary

content.content: 富者は必ずしも幸福ならず、かえって貧者の幸福をうらやむ
The rich are not always happy; on the contrary, they envy the poor their happiness.

content: 2. More; rather; better

content.content: 小量の酒は毒にはならぬかえって薬だ
A little wine does more good than harm.
あなたよりもかえって私がお詫びをしなければなりません
It is for me rather than for you to apologize.
それはかえって言わずにおく方が好い
Better leave it unsaid.
その方がかえって好い
That would be better.
金貨よりかえって札の方が好い
I like paper money better than gold―prefer paper money to gold.
彼は年こそ行かないが思慮はかえって年長者以上だ
Young as he is, he is more thoughtful than his seniors.
君が干渉するとかえってぶちこわすから止せ
Your interference will do more harm than good.
弁解するとかえっておかしい
If you try to excuse yourself, you will make the matter worse.

content: 3. All the more (for); only the more (because)

content.content: 失敗がかえって薬だ
You will be all the better for your failure.
彼はうぶだからかえって可愛い
He is all the more beloved because he is na?ve.
彼は欠点があるからかえって可愛い
I love him only the more because he has faults―only the more for his faults.
病人は転地してかえって悪くした
The invalid is all the worse for his change of air.
あの医者にかかってかえって悪くなったような気がする
I feel all the worse for his treatment.
止めるとかえって募る
Remonstrance will make him only the worse.

content: 4. Positively

content.content: 彼を賞めるどころかかえって非難せねばならぬ
So far from praising him, I must positively blame him.
彼は手助けどころかかえって厄介者だ
Instead of being a help to me, he is a positive encumbrance.
貧家に生まれたのがかえって得だった
My being born poor was a positive advantage.
若い者には金がかえってたたりになる
Money proves a positive curse to young men.
世のいわゆる智なるものはかえって愚である
What the world calls wisdom is a positive folly.
あまりていねいにされるとかえってうるさい
I am positively annoyed by excessive politeness.
あまりていねいにされるのはかえって迷惑だ
Excessive politeness is a positive nuisance.

content: 5. Instead of(前置詞)

content.content: 彼を罰せずにかえって賞した
Instead of punishing him, I rewarded him.

content: 6. Very(形容詞)

content.content: 君が居るとかえって邪魔になる
Your very presence will interfere with the plan.
金があるとかえって勉強のさまたげになる
One's very wealth will interfere with one's studies.
彼は智恵があるためにかえって誤った
His very sagacity misled him.
彼は才があり過ぎてかえって身を誤った
The very excess of cleverness betrayed him into error.

content: 7. ［注意］ 「却って」を英語に訳さぬ場合あり。

content.content: 彼は不幸に遭遇してかえって世の同情を得た
His misfortune won him public sympathy.
彼は職を辞してかえって価値を上げた
His resignation has raised him in the public estimation.
君が干渉するとかえってぶちこわすから止せ
If you interfere, you will make a mess of it.
忙しいとかえって片暇にも勉強するものだ
A busy man will read at odd moments.
風流ならざるところかえって風流
There is taste in the absence of taste.
欲張るとかえって損をする
“Grasp all, lose all.”
天の賜物を取らざればかえってとがめあり
“Take the good the gods provide.”
不幸がかえって幸福となる
One's misfortune turns out a blessing.
お礼を言われてかえって痛み入る
You put me to shame by thanking me.

かえってとく〔却って説く〕
〈熟語〉To return to my subject

content:
かえで〔楓〕
〈名〉The maple (-tree)

content.content: 楓は葉物だ
The maple is a foliage-tree.
楓が紅葉した
The maples have put on their autumnal tints.

content:
かえり〔帰り〕
〈名〉Return; home-coming

content.content: 行きは船、帰りは汽車
I am going by steamer, and coming back by rail.
いつごろお帰りになりますか
When shall you be back?
お帰りのころには僕は東京にいない
I shall have left Tokyo by the time you return.
帰りに君の家へ寄ろう
I will look in upon you on my way home.
これはお帰り、まずご無事でおめでとう
Welcome home! I am glad to see you safe home again.
彼は帰りが遅い
He is a long time gone.
今日はいつもより帰りが遅い
He is longer today than usual.
彼の帰りが遅いのが心配だ
I am uneasy at his long absence―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His long absence makes me feel uneasy.
帰りが遅いので心配をかけてはと思って急いで帰ってきた
I returned in haste lest my long absence should cause you anxiety.
今晩は帰りが遅くなる
I shall be late this evening.
帰りを急ぐ
to hasten home―make the best of one's way home
彼はどうして帰りが遅いのだろう
What can be keeping him?

content:
かえりうち〔返り討ち〕
〈名〉(する方は)killing the avenger:(される方は)being killed by the object of one's vengeance

content.content: 返り討ちにする
to kill the avenger
返り討ちになった
He was killed by the object of his vengeance.

content:
かえりがけに〔帰りがけに〕
〈副〉On one's way back; on one's way home

content.content: 帰りがけに寄らないか
Won't you look in on your way home?

content:
かえりきり〔帰り切り〕
〈名〉A permanent return

content.content: (また行くのか)いや、今度は帰りきりに帰ったのだ
No, I have come home for good (and all).

かえりぐるま〔帰り車〕
〈名〉A returning jinrikisha

content:
かえりざき〔返り咲き〕
〈名〉The second blossom:(=する) to blossom a second time

content.content: 後家さんの返り咲きだ
The widow is young and smart again.
彼は難病がなおって返り咲きをした
He has taken a new lease of life.

かえりしなに〔帰りしなに〕
〈副〉On one's way back; on one's way home

content:
かえりたて〔帰り立て〕
〈形〉Just returned

content.content: 彼は洋行して帰りたてだ、米国から帰りたてだ
He is just returned from abroad―just returned from America.

かえりちゅう〔返り忠〕
〈名〉Going over to the enemy; betraying one's accomplice; treachery:(=する) to go over the enemy; to betray one's accomplice; to give away one's pal; to turn informer against one's accomplice; to turn the state's evidence

かえりに〔帰り荷〕
〈名〉A return-cargo

かえりばな〔返り花〕
〈名〉The second blossom

content:
かえりみる〔省みる、顧みる〕
〈他動〉To look back on (the past); to reflect on (oneself); to have regard to (appearance); to take notice of (public opinion); to look to (one's interests); to think of (oneself)

content.content: 顧みれば二十五年一夢の如し
As I look back on my past life, twenty-five years appears to me but a dream.
己を省みる
to reflect on oneself―meditate on one's life
彼は我が身を顧みずに人を助ける
He helps others, quite unmindful of himself.
我が身のためも少しは顧みなければならない
We must look to our own interests―have an eye to the main chance.
不肖を省みずこの重任に当たったのはこういう次第である
That is the reason I have taken this trust upon myself without reflecting on my want of ability.
若い時は前後を顧みない
The young do not reflect on the consequences.
僕は前後を顧みずにありたけ使ってしまった
I spent all the money I had, without reflecting on the consequences―reckless of the consequences.
前後を顧みずに本分を尽くせ
Do your duty, irrespective of the consequences.
彼は体裁などはさらに顧みない
He has no regard to appearance.
僕は世間の評判などは顧みない
I take no notice of what people say.
彼は学問に一心不乱で余事を顧みるいとまが無い
He is too intent on his studies to think of anything else.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は輿論を顧みずに自分の思うところを行った
I set the public opinion at defiance, and went my own way―I went my own way in defiance of public opinion.
省みてやましきところ無し
I am conscious of having done right―I have an easy conscience.
あえて不遜を省みず意見を述べん
I shall presume to give my opinion.

content:
かえりみる〔省みる、顧みる〕
〈他動〉To look back on (the past); to reflect on (oneself); to have regard to (appearance); to take notice of (public opinion); to look to (one's interests); to think of (oneself)

content.content: 顧みれば二十五年一夢の如し

to reflect on oneself―meditate on one's life

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は輿論を顧みずに自分の思うところを行った
I set the public opinion at defiance, and went my own way―I went my own way in defiance of public opinion.
省みてやましきところ無し
I am conscious of having done right―I have an easy conscience.
あえて不遜を省みず意見を述べん

content:
かえる〔蛙〕
〈名〉The frog

content.content: 蛙が鳴く
A frog croaks.
蛙が跳ぶ
A frog jumps.

content:
かえる〔帰る、還る、返る〕
〈自動〉
1. To return; to go back, come back, get back, be back; to go home, get home, be home:(客などなら)to depart; to leave; to take one's leave; to go away

content.content: いつごろ帰るかね
When shall you be back?
試験に間に合うように帰る
I shall return―come back―be back―in time for the examination.
もう客が帰る
The guests are leaving.
客はチラホラ帰り出す
The guests are departing by twos and threes.
彼はいつも真先に来て一番しまいに帰る
He is always the first to come and the last to go.
君はもう帰ってもよい
You may go away―go home.
さっさと帰れ
Go about your business!―Begone about your business!
家に帰る、我が家へ帰る、内へ帰る
to go home―come home―get home―seek one's home
家へ帰ろうと思う
I think I will go home.
彼はまだ帰りません
He has not come home yet.
六時までにうちへ帰らにゃならぬ
I must be home by six.
十二時過ぎてから家へ帰った
It was past twelve before I got home.
暗くなるから急いでうちへ帰った
As it was getting dark, I made the best of my way home.
生徒はめいめいの家へ帰った
The boys have gone to their several homes.
彼は我が家に帰って一家団欒の裡にあり
He is in the bosom of his family.
内へ帰れば天下様
“Every cock is king on his own dunghill.”
お帰りなさい
Welcome home!
(帰朝者などに向かって)これはお帰りなさい、まずご無事でおめでとう
I am glad to see you safe home again.
国へ帰る
to go home
彼は休暇で国へ帰っている
He is home for the holidays.
賜暇で国へ帰っている
He is home on leave―(軍人なら)―home on furlough
病気で国へ帰っている
He is home on sick-leave.
故郷に帰る
to return to one's old home―see one's native land
僕は生きて故郷に帰れまいと思う
I am afraid I shall never live to see my native land.
生きて帰る者ただ一人
Only one man lived to tell the tale.
錦を着て故郷に帰る
to return home loaded with honours
早く帰れ
(Come home soon―と言わずして)Don't be long!
じきに帰る
I shall not be long.
彼は遅く帰った
He came home late―He was a long time gone.
彼は無事に帰ればよいが
I wish he would return in safety―come back whole.
(逃亡した小僧は)うっちゃつておけば独りで帰って来る
Let him alone, and he will return of his own accord.
彼は洋行して帰ったばかりだ
He is just returned from abroad.
貴方が洋行からお帰りになるころにはこの子も卒業しております
By the time you return from abroad, she will have finished school.
国を去って再び帰らず
He left Japan, never to return.
手紙が付箋がついて帰って来た
The letter returned with a tag attached to it.
振られて帰る果報者
When Venus does not shine upon you, Fortune smiles upon you.
帰らぬ旅に赴く
to depart on one's last journey―die
手を放すと元の位置に返る
If you let it go, it will spring back into place.
光陰去ってまた還らず
Time once past never returns.
呪いは我が身に返る
A curse rebounds upon oneself―“Curses come home to roost.”
我れに返った心地
I feel quit myself―I am myself again.
覆水盆に返らず
“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”
悔いて返らぬ
Regrets will not mend matters―It is gone beyond recall―It is no use crying over spilt milk.
悔いて返らぬことをくよくよする
to indulge in vain regrets
年を取ると子どもに返る
“Old age is a second childhood”―“Old men are twice children.”
縒{より}が返る
(糸なら)to get untwisted―(運動家などの鍛えた身体なら)―lose one's form
さすが女の愚に返り人目無ければ泣きまろぶ
Like the woman that she was, now that she was left to herself, she abandoned herself to grief.
貸した金が返る
A loan is paid back.

content:
かえる〔帰る、還る、返る〕
〈自動〉
1. To return; to go back, come back, get back, be back; to go home, get home, be home:(客などなら)to depart; to leave; to take one's leave; to go away

content.content: いつごろ帰るかね

試験に間に合うように帰る

客はチラホラ帰り出す

彼はいつも真先に来て一番しまいに帰る
He is always the first to come and the last to go.
君はもう帰ってもよい
You may go away―go home.
さっさと帰れ
Go about your business!―Begone about your business!
家に帰る、我が家へ帰る、内へ帰る
to go home―come home―get home―seek one's home
家へ帰ろうと思う
I think I will go home.
彼はまだ帰りません
He has not come home yet.

I must be home by six.

content:
かえる〔替える、換える、代える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=何を何に替える、変ずる)to change (one thing into another); to convert (one thing into another); to turn (one thing into another)

content.content: 熱は水を蒸気に変える
Heat changes water into steam―turns water into steam.
品物を金に替える
to convert goods into money
この小切手を現金に替えて下さい
Please cash this cheque for me.
金を替える
to change money

content: 2. (=何と何を換える、交換する)to exchange (one thing for another); to barter (one thing for another); to give up (one thing for another); to abandon (one thing for another)

content.content: 古い馬をやって若い馬と換えた
I exchanged my old horse for a young one.
玉を与えて米と換えた
He bartered gems for rice.
剣を捨てて筆に換えた
I gave up the sword for the pen.
日本は従来の文明を捨てて泰西の文明に換えたに過ぎぬ
Japan only abandoned her old civilization for the Western.
暴をもって暴に代える
to give tit for tat―give measure for measure
人と位置を換える
to change places with one
僕は何を貰っても彼と位置を換えるのはいやだ
I would not change places with him―stand in his shoes―for the world.
君は僕と位置を換えたらどうするか
What would you do in my place?
何を貰っても命には換えられぬ
Nothing can compensate for the loss of life.
いくら金が儲かっても名誉にゃ換えられぬ
No amount of money can compensate for the loss of honour.
親切は金銭には換えられぬ
Kindness is not to be bought with money.
真正の愛は千金にも換え難い
True love is not to be bought with all the gold in the world.
いくら薬代がかかっても彼の命にゃ換えられぬ
No doctor's bill shall stand in the way of his recovery.
主客地を換える
The (relative) positions are reversed.
背に腹は換えられぬ
“Close sits my shirt, but closer sits my skin.”
幹木に換える梢木無し
One will return to one's former love.

content: 3. (=何に何を代える、代用する)to substitute (one thing for another); to use (one thing) in place of (another)

content.content: 代名詞をもって名詞に代える
A pronoun is substituted for a noun―used instead of a noun.
貨幣が払底すると物品をもって金に代える
When coin is scarce, goods are substituted for money―used in place of money.

content: 4. (=新しくする)to renew (anything old)

content.content: 畳を換える
to replace old mats by new ones
障子をはり替える
to re-paper a screen
壁を塗り替える
to re-plaster the wall
こうもり傘を張り替える
to re-cover an umbrella
井戸を替える
to clean a well―clear a well

かえる〔覆える〕
〈自動〉To overturn; to upset; to turn upside down

content:
かえる〔変える〕
〈他動〉To change (one's name); to alter (a rule); to vary (the tune); to shift (one's position)

content.content: 名を変える
to change one's name
名を隆盛と変えた
He changed his name to Takamori.
校名を正則大学と変える
The school will be renamed Seisoku College.
顔色を変える
to change colour―turn pale
彼は驚いて顔色を変えた
He changed colour in alarm.
顔色を変えてやって来た
He came to me in alarm.
着物を変える
to change one's clothes
足を変える
to change step
意見を変える
to change one's opinion
場所を変える
to change the place
場所を変えて飲み直そう
Let us start afresh in some other place.
言葉を変える
to change one's expression
言葉を変えて言えば彼は世を棄てたのだ
In other words, he renounced the world.
調子を変える
to vary the tune―change one's tune―sing another tune
主義を変える
to change sides―turn one's coat
姿を変える
to disguise oneself
女が男に姿を変える
A woman disguises himself as a man―dresses herself in male attire.
この元素はいろいろに姿を変える
This element appears under various forms.
道を変えて行った
I took a different road.
進路を変える
to alter one's course
進路を変えぬ
to keep one's course―hold on one's course
方針を変える
to depart from one's course
方針を変えぬ
to persevere in one's course
位置を変える
to change the position―shift one's position
議論の立場を変える
to shift one's ground―change front
日を変えてまた伺います
I shall call again another day.
いったん決めたら変えられぬ
Once you make your choice, it must be for better or for worse.
手を変え品を変える
to ring the changes (on anything)
手を変え品を変えやってみたが駄目だった
I rang the changes on the means―tried every possible means―but to no purpose.

content:
かえる〔返る〕
〈接尾詞〉Back

content.content: 飛びかえる
to fly back
跳ねかえる
to rebound
沸きかえる
to boil over
煮えかえる
to seethe

content:
かえる〔孵る〕
〈自動〉To hatch; to be hatched

content.content: 卵がかえる
An egg hatches.
卵がかえった
The eggs are hatched.
雛が十羽かえった
Ten chicks are hatched.
かえらない卵を差引いても八十羽はかえる
Allowing for accidents, we shall have eighty chickens.
かえりたての雛
a nestling

content:
かえん〔火焔〕
〈名〉A flame

content.content: 家は見る見る火焔に包まれた
The house was soon in flames.
彼らは火焔に包まれて逃げ場を失った
They were enveloped in flames, and caught in a trap.
火焔を吐く
to emit fire

content:
がえんずる〔肯ずる〕
〈自動〉To consent, agree (to do something)

content.content: 寄付を勧むれども肯ずる者無し
No one consented to contribute.

content:
がえんぜぬ〔肯ぜぬ〕
〈自動〉Will not; to refuse (to do something)

content.content: 去らしめんとすれども肯ぜず
He would not go away―refused to go away.

content:
かお〔顔〕
〈名〉
1. A face:(文学にては)a visage:(こっけいに言えば)a phiz:(顔立)features

content.content: 美しい顔
a beautiful face
立派な顔
a handsome face
可愛らしい顔
a lovely face―a pretty face
好い顔
a comely face
醜い顔
an ugly face―a homely face―plain features
福々しい顔
a fat and well-liking face
貧相な顔
a pinched face
味な顔だ
She has a piquant face.
男好きのする顔だ
She has a face that attracts men―a face in favour with men.
日に焼けた顔
a sun-burnt face―a sun-browned face
潮風に吹かれた顔
a weather-boaten face
やつれた顔
a haggard face―a haggard countenance
むずかしい顔
a glum face
あの女は顔に遊びがある
She has a blank face―a vacant expression.
顔に遊びが無い
She has a smart face―an intelligent face.
人の顔を見る
to look in one's face―look one in the face
俺の顔を見ろ
Look me in the face!
演説する時は聴衆の顔を見るもの
When you speak in public, you should look your audience in the face.
知らない人の顔をじろじろ見るのは失礼だ
It is bad manners to stare at people.
一人ずつ顔を見たが尋ねる人は居なかった
I examined their faces one by one, but did not see the one I wanted.
穴のあくほど顔を見る
to scrutinize one's face―scan one's face
顔の店卸しをする
to criticize one's face
またもや見合わす顔と顔
They saw each other again face to face.
顔を合わせる
to see one face to face―show one's face―(相撲なら)―be matched against each other―(役者なら)―appear in the same play
二人は互いに顔を合わせながら知らぬ顔
They stood face to face without taking notice of each other.
面目無くて合わす顔が無い
I am ashamed to show my face.
いまさら合わせる顔が無い
I dare not show my face at this time of day.
彼は顔を真赤にしてしゃべっている
He is talking himself red in the face.
顔をしかめる
to make a wry face―make a sour mouth―make a grimace
顔をしかめて吐き出した
He spat out with a wry face.
何食わぬ顔をする
to put a bold face on the matter―put on an innocent air
不機嫌な(いやな)顔をする
to pull a long face
おかしな顔をこしらえる
to make up a face
女が鏡に向かっていろいろな顔をする
A woman makes faces in the glass.
顔を出す
to show one's face―make a call
大使館へちょっと顔を出して来よう
I will just show my face―make a call―at the Embassy―I will pay my respects to my flag.
顔をかたづける
to prim one's face―compose one's features
顔を隠す
to hide one's face
顔をそむける
to turn one's face away―look away
ハンケチで顔をおおう
to cover one's face with one's handkerchief―(普通は)―bury one's face in one's handkerchief
顔に白粉をつける
to powder one's face―paint one's face
顔にべたべた白粉を塗る
to cover one's face thick with powder
顔に微笑を浮かべる
A smile plays on one's face.
顔に微笑を浮かべてそう言った
He said so with a smile (on his face).
顔に角灯をつきつける
to flash a lantern in one's face
顔にしわが寄る
A face becomes wrinkled.
しわの寄った顔
a wrinkled face
美人の顔にしわが寄る
A beautiful face shows the ravages of time.
寒いと顔が荒れる
The face chafes in cold weather.
酒を飲んで顔がほてる
My face is flushed―My cheeks are flushed―with wine.
顔にできものを出す
to have a carbuncle on one's face―A carbuncle forms on one's face
あの顔でそんな悪いことをするかしら
I wonder if, with such a face as hers, she is capable of such wickedness.
どの顔下げて帰られよう
How can I have the face to go home?
どの顔下げて来たか
How can you have the face to come here?
顔から火が出るようだった
I felt as if my face were on fire―I felt a burning shame.
彼女は顔を赤らめる
She blushes.
ポッと顔を赤らめた
A blush passed over her face.
お前の顔にチャンと書いてある
It is written in every line of your face―depicted in every lineament of your countenance.
彼の正直なことは顔を見りゃわかる
You can see by his face that he is honest.
顔は心の表章
“The face is the index of the mind.”
顔に似ぬ心
“A fair face may hide a foul heart.”
彼の心は顔に現れている
His mind looks out of his face.
顔の違うほど心も違う
You will as soon find two of a face as two of a mind―So many faces, so many minds.

content: 2. (=顔つき)a countenance; a look; an air; a face; an expression

content.content: 嬉しそうな顔
a glad look―a joyful countenance―(をする)―to look glad―look joyful
嬉しそうな顔をしてそう言った
She said so with a joyful countenance―with a glad air.
悲しそうな顔
a sad look―a sorrowful countenance―(をする)―to look sad―look sorrowful
悲しそうな顔をしてそう言った
She said so with a sorrowful countenance―with a sad air.
怒った顔
an angry countenance―an angry look―(をする)―to look angry―look black
ぼう然とした顔
a blank look―a vacant expression―(をする)―to look blank―stare vacantly
驚いた顔
a surprised look―(をする)―to look surprised
失望した顔
a disappointed look―(をする)―to look disappointed
安心した顔
a look of relief―(をする)―to look relieved
安心した顔をしてそう言った
He said so with a look of relief.
心配そうな顔
an anxious look―an anxious countenance―(をする)―to look anxious
まじめな顔
a grave look―a grave countenance―(をする)―to look grave
不承不承な顔
a reluctant look―(をする)―to look reluctant
苦い顔をする
to look blue
大きな顔をする
to look big
もっともらしい顔
a serious countenance―a serious look―(をする)―to look serious
もっともらしい顔をしてそう言った
He said so with a serious air―He seriously said so.
こわい顔をする
to look fierce
妙な顔をする
to look queer―give a queer look―make a grimace
物知り顔
a knowing look―(をする)―to look knowing
君は蒼い顔をしている
You look pale―look sallow.
愛嬌のある顔
a pleasing countenance
不愛想な顔
a forbidding countenance
あの男は物騒な顔をしている
He is ill-looking.
人待ち顔
an expectant look
花は今が見頃で人待ち顔だ
The flowers are now at their best, and challenge our admiration.
虫も殺さないような顔をしている
(男なら)He looks as innocent as a lamb―(女なら)―She looks as if butter would not melt in her mouth.
何食わぬ顔をする
to put on an innocent air
何食わぬ顔をして入って来た
He came in with an innocent air.
彼は得意顔をして帰って来た
He returned with a triumphant countenance―with a triumphant air―in triumph.
平気な顔をして眺めておった
He was looking on with an unconcerned countenance―with an unconcerned air.
わがもの顔
a lordly air
あまり顔を見られてきまりが悪かった
I was stared out of countenance.
あの女優は舞台顔が好い、舞台顔がわるい
She looks well on the stage―does not look well on the stage.
(舞台顔より)素顔の方が好い
She looks better off the stage (than on the stage).

content: 3. (=相好)features; look; favour

content.content: 瓜実顔
classic features
鼻筋の通った顔
regular features
不器量な顔
plain features
あの女は好い顔をしている
She is good-looking―well-favoured.
彼は鬼のような顔をしている
He is hard-featured―hard-favoured.
彼女は妙な顔をした
Her features worked strangely.
苦しそうな顔をした
Her features worked violently.

content: 4. (=面目)honour

content.content: 人の顔を立てる
to save one's honour―save one's face
そうすれば大臣の顔も立つ
Thus the Minister's honour is saved.
自分の顔を立てる
to vindicate one's honour
この金を返さなければ顔が立たぬ
It is a point of honour with me to pay this money―It is a debt of honour.
今度こそどんなことをしても成功しなけりゃ顔が立たぬ
It is a point of honour with me to succeed at any cost this time.
友人に対して顔が立つ
I have done my duty by my friend.
顔にかかる
to concern one's honour
成功しなけりゃ顔にかかる
It concerns my honour if I do not succeed.
人の顔をつぶす
to ignore one
それでは僕の顔がつぶれるじゃないか
Then I shall lose my face―Then where do I come in?
親の顔に泥を塗る
to disgrace one's father―bring disgrace on one's father
お前は親の顔に泥を塗る奴だ
You are a disgrace to your father.
亭主の顔に泥を塗る
to dishonour one's husband―deceive one's husband―cover one's husband with shame
亭主が顔に泥を塗られる
The husband is covered with shame―One cherishes a viper in one's bosom.

content: 5. (=勢力)influence

content.content: 彼はたいそう好い顔になっている
He is a man of influence.

content:
6. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 顔を洗う
to wash oneself
顔を洗って出直して来い
I will have nothing to do with you.
顔を剃る
to shave oneself
毎朝顔を剃る
I shave myself every morning.
顔を剃らせる
to get shaved
顔を剃ってくれ
I want to get shaved―I want to have a shave.
(床屋で「お刈りになりますか」と聞かれ)顔だけ
Only a shave.
顔を上げる
to look up
女は顔を赤くした(顔に紅葉を散らした)
She blushed.
顔を真赤にした
She blushed to the roots of her hair.
男は激して顔を赤くした
He flushed with anger.
(運動などして)顔を真赤にしている
He is in a glow―all of a glow.
僕は酒を飲むとじきに顔へ出る
I soon get flushed with wine.
君は酒が顔に出ないね
Wine does not flush you.
顔の相好を崩して笑う
to grin broadly―(笑っている)―He is on the broad grin.
人の顔を知っている
to know one by sight
生徒の顔は知っているが名は一々知らぬ
I know the students by sight, but not by name.
彼は顔が売れている(顔が広い)
He is widely known.
彼は僕がいても知らぬ顔をしておった
He took no notice of me.
知らぬ顔をして通り過ぎた
He passed by me without taking notice of me.
面目無くて人に合わす顔が無い
I am ashamed to appear in public.
こう失敗しては人に合わす顔が無い
After such a failure on my part, I dare not appear in public.
顔を見合わす
to exchange glances
互いに顔を見合わして目くばせする
to exchange a look of intelligence
彼と顔を見合わせた
My eyes met his―Our eyes met―We looked at each other.
顔を見合わしてビクリとした
Our eyes met, and we started.
居並ぶ人々は互いに顔を見合わした
The people present looked at each other.
あきれて顔を見合わした
We looked at each other in astonishment.
二人は土俵で顔が逢ったことが無い
They were never matched against each other―never pitted against each other.
二人は舞台で顔を合わしたことが無い
They never appeared in the same play.
彼は二人の顔を見比べた
He looked from one to the other.
彼が突然顔を出すと皆驚いた
We were surprised at his sudden appearance.
ちょっとお顔拝借(顔を貸して下さい)
Can you spare me five minutes?
皆知らない顔ばかりだ
They are all strangers to me.
これで顔が揃った
We are all here.
仏の顔も三度ということがある
You are enough to provoke a saint.
彼は何を頼まれてもいやな顔をしない
He complies readily with any request―does willingly whatever you ask him to.
逢いたい見たい顔見たい
I am dying to see her.
彼は女の顔さえ見ればにやにや笑う
He grins like a baboon.
金持顔をする(金持ちぶる)
to pretend to wealth
金持顔をして立派な家に住んでいる
He lives in a fine house, as if he were rich.
貧乏顔をする(貧乏なふりをする)
to pretend to be poor
貧乏顔をして(食うものも食わぬ)
He denies himself the comforts of life, as if he were poor.
彼はわがもの顔をしている
He lords it over the place.

content:
かおあわせ〔顔合せ〕
〈名〉(相撲なら)being matched against each other:(役者なら)appearance in the same play:(=する) to be matched against each other; to appear in the same play

content.content: 二人は土俵で顔合せしたことが無い
They were never matched against each other―never pitted against each other.
二人は舞台で顔合せをしたことが無い
They never appeared in the same play.

content:
かおいろ〔顔色〕
〈名〉
1. (=顔の色、色ざし)colour; complexion

content.content: 彼女は顔色が好い
She has a good complexion―a fair complexion―a beautiful complexion.
君は顔色が悪い、どうかしたか
You look sallow. Is anything the matter with you?
顔色が好くなる、顔色が悪くなる
to gain colour―lose colour
顔色を変える
to change colour
彼は驚いて顔色を変えた
He grew alarmed, and changed colour―turned pale.
彼は顔色を変えて来た
He came to me in alarm.

content: 2. (=顔つき)a look; a countenance

content.content: 彼は不安そうな顔色をしていた
He looked uneasy.
彼は怒っても顔色に出さない
He does not betray his anger in his countenance.
顔色が変わって来た
A change has come over his countenance.
彼は人の顔色ばかりうかがっている
He hangs on your smiles.

かおおおい〔顔蔽い〕
〈名〉A veil

content:
かおかたち〔顔形〕
〈名〉Face and figure

content.content: 顔形はお母さんそっくりそのままだ
She is the very image of her mother―the very moral of her mother.

content:
かおく〔家屋〕
〈名〉A house; a building

content.content: 家屋税
a house-tax

content:
かおぞろい〔顔揃い〕
〈名〉A fair show of names

content.content: 大した顔揃いだ
There is a grand show of names.
先生達が顔揃いだから生徒が集まるだろう
The teachers make a good show, and will attract many students.

content:
かおだし〔顔出し〕
〈名〉Showing one's face; a call; appearance; attendance:(=する) to show one's face; to call (at a house); to make a call; to appear; to make one's appearance; to put in an appearance; to attend (a meeting)

content.content: ちょっと大使館へ顔出しをして来よう
I will make a call at the Embassy―pay my respects to my flag.
彼はまだ一度も僕のところへ顔出しをしない
He has not called at my place yet.
彼はあまり世間へ顔出しをしない
He does not appear much in public.
面目無くて世間に顔出しができない
I am ashamed to appear in public.
会に顔出ししなくちゃ悪いだろう
I think I ought to attend the meeting.

content:
かおだち〔顔立ち〕
〈名〉A cast of countenance; features

content.content: 彼女は顔立ちが好い
She has regular features.
顔立ちは十人並み
She has normal features.
顔立ちはお母さんだ
She has her mother's cast of countenance.
顔立ちはお母さんそっくりそのままだ
Her features are her mother's to a hair―She is the very image of her mother―the very moral of her mother.

content:
かおつき〔顔付〕
〈名〉A cast of countenance; a countenance; a face; an expression; an air; a look; looks; features

content.content: あの娘は可愛らしい顔つきをしている
He has a sweet face―a sweet countenance―She is sweet-looking.
好い顔じゃないが顔つきが好い
She has not a good face, but a sweet expression.
顔つきはお母さんだ
She has her mother's cast of countenance.
顔つきはお母さんそっくりそのままだ
Her features are her mother's to a hair―She is the very image of her mother―the very moral of her mother.
あの男は物騒な顔つきだ
He is ill-looking.
ウサンくさい顔つきだ
He is suspicious-looking.
嬉しそうな顔つき
a glad look―a joyful countenance
悲しそうな顔つき
a sad look―a sorrowful countenance
人をばかにしたような顔つきをした
He gave a contemptuous look―assumed a scornful air.
一癖ありそうな顔つき
a sinister countenance
彼の正直なことは顔つきでわかる
You can see by his face that he is honest.

content:
かおなじみ〔顔馴染〕
〈名〉A familiar face

content.content: 今度の学校には顔馴染がたくさんある
There are many old familiar faces in the new school.

content:
かおぶれ〔顔触れ〕
〈名〉A show of names; the personnel

content.content: 新内閣の顔ぶれ
the personnel of the new Cabinet
顔ぶれが好い
There is a fair show of names.
発起人の顔ぶれはなかなか揃っている
The promoters make quite a good show of names.

かおみせ〔顔見世〕
〈名〉(一人なら)one's first appearance on the stage; one's d?but:(連中のなら)the whole troupe of actors introducing themselves to the audience

content:
かおむけ〔顔向け〕
〈名〉Showing one's face:(=する) to show one's face

content.content: 面目無くて世間に顔向けもできない
I am ashamed to show my face in public―ashamed to appear in public.

content:
かおやく〔顔役〕
〈名〉A man of influence; a chief; a boss; the leader of a set

content.content: 彼は押しも押されもせぬ立派な顔役だ
He is the acknowledged leader of his set.

content:
かおよごし〔顔汚し〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: つらよごし〔面汚し〕

content:
かおり〔薫り〕
〈名〉Smell; scent; odour; perfume; fragrance; aroma

content.content: 薔薇はかおりが好い
The rose smells sweet―The rose has a sweet smell.
花のかおり
the scent of flowers―the fragrance of flowers
空気は花のかおりに満ちている
The air is redolent of flowers―heavy with the scent of flowers.
かおりの好い花
a sweet-scented flower

content:
かおる〔薫る〕
〈自動〉To smell; to be fragrant; to be redolent (of flowers)

content.content: 花園は花の香がかおっている
The garden is redolent of flowers.

content:
がおる〔我折る〕
〈自動〉To yield; to bend; to drop; to languish; to pine; to be dashed; to be dejected; to be downcast; to be cast down

content.content: 失敗して我折っている
He is dejected at his failure―dashed at his failure―cast down by his failure.

content:
かか〔呵々〕
〈間投詞〉Ha! ha!

content.content: 呵々大笑す
to laugh a loud laugh―roar with laughter

content:
がか〔画家〕
〈名〉A painter; an artist; a knight of the brush

content.content: 肖像画家
a portrait painter
山水画家
a landscape painter
油絵画家
a painter in oils
水彩画家
a painter in water-colours
文人画家
a painter of the literary school

content:
がが〔峨々〕
〈形〉Craggy; rugged

content.content: 峨々たる山岳
craggy mountains

content:
かかあ〔嚊〕
〈名〉A wife

content.content: かかあ持つ
to take a wife―get married
うちのかかあ
my old woman―the missis
人のかかあには指でも指すな
Do not look at a neighbour's wife.
かかあ天下
petticoat government
かかあの尻に敷かれる
to be henpecked―tied to one's wife's apron-strings
かかあ孝行
an uxorious husband
かかあの方が偉い
“The gray mare is the better horse.”

かかあてんか〔嚊天下〕
〈名〉Petticoat government

content:
かがい〔加害〕
〈名〉Assault

content.content: 加害者
an assailant

かがい〔禍害〕
〈名〉Evil; harm; mischief

content:
がかい〔瓦解〕
〈名〉Disintegration; disorganization; dissolution; ruin; wreck; fall; downfall; overthrow; a collapse; a break-up; a smash; a crash; d?b?cle:(=する) to disintegrate; to become disorganized; to be dissolved; to go to ruin; to go to wreck; to go to pieces; to go to smash; to smash; to collapse; to break up; to fall; to be overthrown

content.content: ロシアの瓦解
the disintegration of Russia
幕府の瓦解
the downfall of the Shogunate
幕府瓦解して明治政府立つ
The Meiji government rose on the ruins of the Shogunate.
ローマ帝国の瓦解
the fall of the Roman Empire
ローマ帝国瓦解して現今の欧州各国となる
The Roman Empire broke up into the modern European states.
内閣の瓦解
a dissolution of the Cabinet―the downfall of a Cabinet
内閣が瓦解する
A Cabinet is dissolved―A Cabinet goes out.
あの家は瓦解してしまった
The house has gone to ruin―gone to wreck.
山師会社は早晩瓦解する
A bogus company will sooner or later go to pieces―go all to smash―collapse.
あの会社が瓦解すると幾千という職工が糊口の道を失う
If that company should collapse, thousands of hands would lose their means of livelihood.
彼が死んだらあの事業が瓦解してしまう
If he should die, his work would go to pieces.

かがいこうぎ〔課外講義〕
〈名〉A special lecture

かがいしゃ〔加害者〕
〈名〉An assailant

content:
かかえ〔抱え〕
〈名〉Holding in one's arms

content.content: ひと抱えの薪
an armful of wood
その木はひと抱えある
You can just encircle the tree with your arms.
木の周囲が三抱えもある
The tree measures round as much as three stretches of your arms―Three men can just encircle the tree with their arms.

content: 〈形〉(=の) in one's employ

content.content: 抱え車夫
a jinrikishaman in one's employ
抱え俥
a private jinrikisha
抱えの子
a geisha in one's employ
抱えが七人もいる
She has no fewer than seven girls in her employ.
あの子は自前か抱えか
Is she her own mistress or in another's employ?

content:
かかえる〔抱える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=抱いて持つ)to hold (anything) in one's arms

content.content: 女が大きな包みをかかえておった
She had a large bundle in her arms.
包みを抱えて電車に乗った
She got into the car with a bundle in her arms.
小脇に抱える
to hold anything under one's arm
本を小脇に抱えて出て来た
He came out with a book under his arm.
彼は頭を抱えて本を読んでおった
He was reading with his head between his hands.
頭を抱えて逃げ出した
He field with his hands to his head―beat a disgraceful retreat.
腹を抱えて笑う
to hold one's sides with laughter
大きな腹を抱えている
She is with child―in the family way.
臨月の腹を抱えている
She is near her time.
病人を抱えている
We have an invalid to care for.
病人を抱えて花見でもあるまい
With an invalid to care for, a cherry-party is not to be thought of.

content: 2. (=雇う)to employ; to engage; to keep; to take (a man) into one's service

content.content: 外国人を抱える
to engage a foreigner
学校では外国人を三人抱えている
The school has three foreigners in its employ.
彼はある外国人に抱えられている
He is in the service of a foreigner.
昔大名は米何石で家来を抱えておいたものだ
The daimyos used to keep their retainers at so many koku of rice a year.
彼は馬車などを抱えて紳士を気どっている
He keeps a carriage, and sets up for a gentleman.
君は馬車ぐらいは抱えられる身分だ
You can afford to keep a carriage―You are rich enough to afford a carriage.
ここに住めば俥を抱える世話が無い
If I live here, I shall not have to go to the expense of keeping a jinrikisha.

content:
かかく〔価格〕
〈名〉Value; price; worth

content.content: 価格を定める
to set a value on an article
価格をつける
to value goods―appraise goods―(at so much)
物品は一万円の価格がついている
The goods are valued at 10,000 yen.
市場価格
the market price
見積り価格
estimated value
価格表
a price-list
価格表記郵便
value declared post
価格千円の品物
a thousand yen's worth of goods

かかく〔家格〕
〈名〉The family rank

content.content: 化学者
a chemist
化学的変化
a chemical change
化学的作用
chemical action
化学的反応
a chemical reaction
化学分析
chemical analysis
化学記号
a chemical symbol
化学式
a chemical formula
化学方程式
a chemical equation
化学実験
a chemical experiment
化学実験室
a chemical laboratory
化学工業
chemical industry
化学工芸学
chemical technology
化学試薬
a chemical reagent
化学器械
a chemical apparatus
有機化学、無機化学
organic chemistry―inorganic chemistry
応用化学
applied chemistry

かがく〔家学〕

content:
かがく〔科学〕
〈名〉Science:(=の) scientific

content.content: 科学の発達
the advancement of science
十九世紀は科学が著しく進歩した
Science made remarkable progress in the Nineteenth Century.
二十世紀は科学の天下である
Science reigns supreme in the Twentieth Century.
飛行機の発明も科学の賜物である
The invention of the aeroplane is due to science―It is all owing to science that the aeroplane has been invented―Thanks to science, man can now fly.
科学者
a scientist―a scientific man―a savant
科学語
a scientific term
科学研究
scientific researches
科学的研究法
the scientific method of research
厳正科学
exact science
純正科学
pure science
応用科学
applied science
科学万能主義
scientism

instrumental drawing

a court musician

to post anything value declared

content:
かかげる〔掲げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=上げる)to put up (a notice); to hang out (a sign); to hoist (a flag)

content.content: 白旗を掲げる
to hoist a white flag―show a white flag―display the flag of truce
敵艦が白旗を掲げて来た
An enemy ship came flying the flag of truce.
国旗を掲げる
to hoist the national flag―put up a flag
市中至るところに国旗が掲げてある
The flag is up all over the town.
半旗を掲げて弔意を表す
to half-mast the flag (in token of mourning)
看板を掲げる
to hang out a sign―put up a signboard
表札を掲げる
to put up a name-tablet
演題を掲げる
to announce the subject of a speech

content: 2. (=掲載する)to insert, mention, publish (in a newspaper)

content.content: その名が一々官報に掲げられる
Their names are all published in the Official Gazette.
君のことが新聞に掲げてある
You are mentioned in the papers.

content: 3. (=まくりあげる)to tuck up

content.content: 衣をかかげる
to tuck up one's skirt

content:
かかし〔案山子〕
〈名〉A scarecrow:(看板の人の意味なら)a figurehead

content.content: 案山子のような姿だ
He is a scarecrow of a figure.
案山子のような長官だ
He is a figurehead of a chief.

content:
かがし〔案山子〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かかし〔案山子〕

content:
かかす〔欠かす〕
〈他動〉To fail to attend, absent oneself from, stay away from, miss (a meeting, etc.)

content.content: 講義を欠かす
to cut a lecture
彼は一度も欠かさず会に出席した
He never stayed away from the meeting―never missed a meeting.
彼は照っても降っても欠かさず散歩をする
He makes a point of taking a walk in rain or shine.
季節季節の行事を欠かさないのが江戸っ子だ
The Tokyo people never miss the pleasures of the season.

content:
かかせる〔書かせる〕
〈他動〉To have (anything) written; to cause (anything) to be written

content.content: 手紙を書かせておいた
I have had a letter written.
彼に証文を書かせた
I made him sign a paper.
僕の言う通り証文を書かせた
I dictated the terms to him.

content:
かかせる〔畫かせる、画かせる〕
〈他動〉To have (a picture) painted; to cause (a picture) to be painted

content.content: 彼は自分の肖像を画かせた
He had his portrait painted―(文章では)―He caused his portrait to be painted―(他の言い方は)―He sat for his portrait―sat to a portrait-painter.

content:
かかせる〔畫かせる、画かせる〕
〈他動〉To have (a picture) painted; to cause (a picture) to be painted

content.content: 彼は自分の肖像を画かせた
He had his portrait painted―(文章では)―He caused his portrait to be painted―(他の言い方は)―He sat for his portrait―sat to a portrait-painter.

content:
かかと〔踵〕
〈名〉The heel

content.content: 靴のかかと
the heel of a shoe
かかとの高い靴、かかとの低い靴
high-heeled shoes―low-heeled shoes
靴下のかかと
the heel of a sock
かかとが切れた
The heels are worn through.

content:
かがと〔踵〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かかと〔踵〕

がーがーなく〔ガーガー鳴く〕
〈自動〉(Ducks) quack; (frogs) croak

content:
かがみ〔鑑〕
〈名〉A mirror; a model; a pattern; a paragon; an example; an exemplar

content.content: 武士の鑑だ
He is a mirror of knighthood.
女子の鑑だ
She is a model of womanhood.
淑徳の鑑
She is a paragon of virtue―a pattern of female honour.
人の鑑となる
to set an example to others

content:
かがみ〔鏡〕
〈名〉
1. A mirror; a looking-glass; a glass:(人体の凹部を拡大する鏡)a speculum

content.content: 鏡を見る
to look in the mirror―look in the glass
己が姿を鏡で見る
to look at oneself in the mirror―see oneself in the glass
鏡と相談しておいで
Consult your glass!
鏡に映る
to be reflected in the mirror―be reflected in the glass
鏡に映る顔
the face reflected in the glass―the reflection of the face in the glass―the image of the face in the glass
この鏡はおかしく映る
This glass distorts your features.
鏡が曇っている
The mirror is dim.
鏡に息を吹きかけると曇る
A mirror, when breathed upon, grows dim.
鏡のような海
a glassy sea
鏡にかけて見る如し
It is as clear as day.
遠く離れて
When far apart are we,
逢われぬ時に
And can't each other see,
月が鏡と
I wish the moon could be
なれば好い
A mirror clear to me!

content: 2. (=樽の鏡)the head (of a barrel)

content.content: 鏡を抜く
to take out the barrel-head

かがみいた〔鏡板〕
〈名〉A panel

かがみびらき〔鏡開き〕
〈名〉Cutting up the New Year's cake

かがむ〔屈む〕
〈自動〉To stoop; to bow; to bend; to crouch

content:
かがめる〔屈める〕
〈他動〉To bend (one's knees); to bow (one's head)

content.content: 腰をかがめる
to stoop―bend one's knees―bend the knee
首をかがめる
to bow one's head
首をかがめて
with bowed head
身をかがめる(敬礼する)
to bow―make a bow

content:
かがやかす〔輝かす〕
〈他動〉To make (anything) shine

content.content: 名を世界に輝かす
to win a world-wide fame
誉を代々に輝かす
to shed lustre on one's family
武名を輝かす
to shine with military glory―win military renown
日本は武威を世界に輝かした
Japan has dazzled the world with her military glory.

かがやき〔輝き〕
〈名〉The splendour (of the sun); the glitter (of gold); the sparkle (of gems); the flash (of a sword in the sun); the gleam (of a sword in the dark); the glint (of cold steel); the glisten (of dewdrops); the lustre (of metals); the glow (of an incandescent lamp); the twinkle (of stars); the brightness (of a new coin); the brilliancy (of a reputation)

content:
かがやく〔輝く〕
〈自動〉(The sun and moon) shine; (stars) twinkle; (gold and silver) glitter; (gems) sparkle; (swords) flash (in the sun); (swords) gleam (in the dark); (cold steel) glints; (dewdrops) glisten; (an incandescent lamp) glows; (a new coin) is bright

content.content: 光り輝く
to be brilliant―radiant―resplendent
空が夕日に輝く
The sky glows with the setting sun.
朝日に輝く日の丸の旗
The sun-flag glows in the morning sun.
黄金は輝く
Gold glitters.
輝く物必ずしも黄金ならず
“All is not gold that glitters.”
皆の顔が喜色に満ちて輝いた
Their faces lighted up with joy.
皆の目は喜色に満ちて輝いた
Their eyes kindled with joy―sparkled with pleasure.

content:
かかり〔掛り、係り〕
〈名〉
1. (=担任)charge

content.content: かかりの役人
the official in charge
かかりの者に注意しておきましょう
I will call the attention of the persons in charge to the matter.
かかりの医者
the physician in charge
会計の係は誰ですか
Who is in charge of the accounts?
彼は簿記係だ
He is in charge of the books―the book-keeper.
これは僕の係でない
The matter is not in my charge―I am not in charge of the matter.
ここは係が違います
You have come to the wrong office.
接待係
the reception committee
僕も接待係だ
I am on the reception committee.

content: 2. (=入費)expenses; cost

content.content: かかりがかかる
The expenses are heavy―It is expensive.
自動車はかかりがかかる
A motor-car is expensive to keep.
かかりがかかるから利益が少ない
There is no profit, as the expenses are heavy.
家のかかりが二百円かかる
The household expenses come to 200 yen a month.
かかりがいくらかかるか
What are the expenses?―What does it cost?
田舎に居るとかかりがかからない
It costs little to live in the country.
暮らしにかかりがいくらかかるか
What is the cost of living?―What does living cost?

content: 3. (=負担)the burden of taxation; the taxes

content.content: 人民はかかりが多いので苦しんでいる
The people groan under the heavy burden―The taxes bear hard on the people.
戦争後急にかかりが多くなった
The taxes have suddenly increased since the war.

content: 4. (=入用)requirement

content.content: 十人かかりの仕事だ
The work requires ten men―It takes ten men to do the work.
二人がかりで仕事をかたづけよう
We will finish the work between us.
三人がかりでビールを一ダース平げた
We finished a dozen bottles of beer among us three.
五人がかりなら家の掃除は楽だ
We can easily clean the house among us five.
総がかりで仕事をやってしまった
We have finished the work among us all.

content: 5. (=関係)relation

content.content: この語のかかりがわからない
I can't see the relation of this word to the other parts of the sentence.

content: 6. (=寄食)dependence

content.content: 彼は親がかりの身だ
He is dependent on his father.

content: 7. (=構造)structure; build

content.content: その家のかかりはどんなだ
How is the house built?

content: 8. (鍵のかかるところ)the catch (of a key):(釣針のさかとげ)the bard (of a hook)
