かかりあい〔掛り合い〕
〈名〉
1. (=関係)relation
2. (=連累)concern, implication, involvement, entanglement (in an affair)

content.content: そんなことにかかり合いはまっぴらごめんだ
I don't wish to be concerned in such an affair―I will have nothing to do with such a matter―I will have no hand in such an affair―I wash my hands of the affair.
誰もかかり合いが怖いからその金を取る者が無かった
No one would take the money, for they were afraid to be implicated in the affair―involved in the affair―entangled in the affair.
そんな後暗い取引にかかり合いはいやだ
I object to being mixed up in such shady transactions.

content:
かかりあう〔掛り合う〕
〈他動〉To be concerned in, be implicated in, be involved in, be entangled in, be mixed up in, have something to do with (an affair)

content.content: そんなことにかかり合うのはまっぴらごめんだ
I don't wish to be concerned in such an affair―I will have no hand in such an affair―I wash my hands of the affair―I will have nothing to do with such a matter.
今度の疑獄にかかり合っている者がたくさんある
Many people are implicated in the scandal―involved in the scandal―entangled in the scandal.
あんな女にかかり合ってはたいへんだ
You must not have anything to do with such a woman.
そんな後暗い取引にかかり合うのはいやだ
I will not be mixed up in such shady transactions.
そんなことにかかり合い給うな
Do not concern yourself in such matters!―Do not mix yourself up in such matters!―Have nothing to do with such matters!

かかりいん〔係り員〕
〈名〉A person in charge

かかりご〔掛り子〕
〈名〉A child to whom one looks for support in one's old age; one's support in old age

content:
かかりつけ〔掛りつけ〕
〈形〉Regular

content.content: かかりつけの医者
one's regular physician―the family doctor

content:
がかりで〔掛りで〕
〈接尾詞〉Between; among

content.content: 二人がかりで仕事をやってしまおうじゃないか
Let us finish the work between us.
君達三人がかりでビールを一ダース平げたのか
Have you finished a dozen bottles of beer among you three?
総がかりでやったら一日でやってしまえるだろう
W can finish it in a day among us all.

かかりば〔繋船場〕
〈名〉An anchorage; moorings; roads; a roadstead

content:
かがりび〔篝火〕
〈名〉A bonfire; a watch-fire; a camp-fire; a signal-fire; a fishing-fire

content.content: かがり火を焚く
to light a bonfire

かかりびと〔寄食者〕
〈名〉A dependant; a hanger-on

content:
かかりまけ〔掛り負け〕
〈名〉Excess of expenses over profits

content.content: かかり負けになる
The expenses exceed the profits―The profits do not cover the expenses―“The game is not worth the candle.”

content:
かかる〔掛かる、懸かる、罹る、係る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=ぶらさがる)to hang; to be hung

content.content: 壁に地図が掛かっている
A map hangs on the wall.
壁に鉄砲がかかっている
A gun hangs against the wall.
釘に帽子がかかっている
A hat hangs on the peg.
机の上にランプがかかっている
A lamp hang over the table.
門に看板がかかっている
A signboard hangs over the door.
君の帽子は帽子掛けにかかっている
Your hat hangs on the peg.
西の空に新月がかかっている
The new moon hangs in the western sky.
壁に額がかかっている
(額を主とすれば)A picture hangs on the wall―(壁を主とすれば)―The wall is hung with pictures.
床の間に掛け物がかかっている
A scroll hangs in the alcove―The alcove is hung with a scroll.
窓に幕がかかっている
The window is hung with a curtain.
頂上に雲がかかっている
A cloud hangs over the summit.
月に雲がかかっている
The moon is behind a cloud.
太陽に雲がかかっている
The sun is obscured (by a cloud).

content: 2. (=寄り掛かる)to lean (against the wall ―on a desk); to bear (against the wall ―on the posts)

content.content: 椅子に掛かる
to sit on a chair―sit in a chair
屋根に梯子が掛かっている
A ladder stands against the roof.
肩にかかる
to lie on one's shoulders―rest on one's shoulders―fall on one's shoulders
全責任が僕の双肩にかかる
The whole responsibility rests on my shoulders.
入費が皆僕にかかる
All the expenses fall on me.
親が死ぬと借金が子どもにかかる
When a father dies, his debts devolve on his son.
負担は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.

content: 3. (=たよる)to depend on (something); to hang on (something)

content.content: 彼はまだ親にかかっている
He is still dependent on his father.
未亡人は行く末あの男の子にかかるつもりだ
The widow intends to depend on her boy in her old age―She looks to her boy for support in her old age.
我が国の運は青年諸子の将来の努力にかかっている
The destiny of the nation depends upon your future efforts, young men!
彼の生命は一にかかって君の判決にあり
His life hangs upon your decision.

content: 4. (=引っかかる)to catch; to be caught

content.content: 凧が電線にかかった
The kite has caught on a telegraph wire.
死体は橋杭にかかっていた
The body was caught on a pile.
釘に着物がかかった
A nail caught my clothes―My clothes caught on a nail.
網にかかる
to be caught in a net
魚が網にかかる
Fish are caught in a net.
法網にかかる
to fall into the clutches of the law―fall into the meshes of the law
係蹄{わな}にかかる
to fall into a trap―fall into a snare
鍵がかからぬ
The key will not catch.

content: 5. (=陥る)to fall into (a trap, etc.)

content.content: 敵の計略にかかる
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap
悪計にかかる
to fall a victim to a scheme
君は悪漢の計略にかかったのだ
You have fallen a victim to the schemes of a knave.

content: 6. (=係わる)to relate to (anything); to concern (one); to affect (anything)

content.content: この関係代名詞は何にかかのるか
What does this relative pronoun relate to?
これをしなけりゃ僕の面目にかかわる(顔に係る、名誉に関する)
It concerns my honour―It is a point of honour with me―to do this.
これは首にかかる問題だ
The matter concerns my life―It is a hanging matter―It is a life-or-death question.
命にかかる
to concern one's life―endanger one's life
命にかかる病だ
It is a fatal disease.
この病は命にはかからぬ
The disease is not fatal.
命にかかる傷だ
It is a mortal wound―(けがなら)―a fatal injury.
国民一般にかかる問題だ
The question concerns the whole nation.
海運は国運にかかる
Marine transportation affects the national prosperity.

content: 7. (=取り掛かる)to set about (one's task); to go to work; to fall to work; to set to work; to turn to work; to proceed to business; to begin (doing something); to be going to (do something); to be about to (do something); to be engaged in (some work); to be occupied with (some work); to be engaged on (a new work); to have (a work) in hand

content.content: もう普請にかかっている
They have begun building the house.
早速仕事にかかろう
I will set about my task at once.
早速議事にかかります
We shall proceed to business at once.
朝起きるとすぐ仕事にかかる
I go to work―set to work―turn to work―as soon as I get up.
彼は著述にかかっている
He is engaged in literary work―occupied with literary work.
字書の編纂にかかっている
He is engaged in compiling a dictionary―occupied in compiling a dictionary.
新著述にかかっている
He is engaged on a new work―He has a new work in hand.
その仕事にはまだかかっていない
The work is not yet in hand.
この本を読みかかっている
I am going to read this book―about to read this book.
その人は死にかかっていた
He was dying―He lay at the point of death.
花は開きかかっている
The flowers are opening.
本は今印刷にかかっている
The book is printing―in the press.
大工は今屋根にかかっている
The carpenters are working at the roof.
その仕事に十人かかっている
Ten men are engaged on the work.
大勢かかってやっと仕事をし終った
The work has at last been completed among many men―by the united efforts of many men.
たすきがけでかかる
to buckle to one's task
茶にしてかかる
to trifle with one's task―make light of one's task

content: 8. (=要する)to require (trouble); to take (time or men); to cost (money or labour); to involve (expense)

content.content: どのくらい日数(年数)がかかるか
How long will it take?
いくら金がかかるか
What will it cost?
一文もかからぬ
It will cost you nothing.
何人かかるか
How many men will it take?
この船を操縦するのに何人かかるか
How many men does it take to work this ship?
英語を修めるに十年かかる
It takes ten years to master English.
僕は英語を修めるに十年かかった
It took me ten years to master English―I took ten years to master English―I was ten years in mastering English.
そんな家を造るには一万円はかかる
Such a house will cost 10,000 yen.
この家は一万円かかった
This house cost me 10,000 yen.
この本を書くのに三年かかった
It took me three years to write this book―The book cost me three years' labour.
戦争をすると金がかかる
War costs money.
訴訟を起こすと入費がかかる
A lawsuit involves expense.
訴訟は手数がかかる
A lawsuit requires much trouble.
旅行は費用がかかる
Travelling involves expense―Travelling is expensive.
費用はいくらかかっても洋行する
I will go abroad whatever it may cost―cost what it may―regardless of expense.
軍艦を造るには莫大の金がかかる
Warships cost enormous sums of money.
よほど手のかかった品だ
The article must have cost a great deal of labour.
君の病気は今月いっぱいかかる
It will take you all this month to recover from your illness.
この病気は長くかかる
It takes long to recover from this disease―It is a lingering disease.
彼は全快するにはまだ暫くかかる
It will take him some time to get well―(と言うよりも普通)―It will be some time before he gets well.
全快までには二三週間はかかる(二三週間経たなけりゃ全快せぬ)
It will be some weeks before he gets well.
僕のところは学校へ五分かからぬ
I live within five minutes' walk of the school.
病にかかる
to be taken ill―be seized with an illness―be attacked with a disease―contract a disease
病にかかっている
I am suffering from an illness―afflicted with a disease―troubled with a disease.
誰か急病にかかった
Somebody was suddenly taken ill―seized with a sudden illness.
彼は洋行中病気にかかった
He was taken ill―seized with an illness―while abroad.
肺炎にかかった
He was attacked with pneumonia.
今肺炎にかかっている
He has an attack of pneumonia―He is suffering from pneumonia.
流行性感冒にかかった
I was attacked with influenza.
流行性感冒にかかっている
I have an attack of influenza―I am suffering from influenza.
流行性感冒にかかって寝ている
I am laid up with an attack of influenza.
流行性感冒にかかっている者がたくさんある
Many people are suffering from influenza―There are many cases of influenza.
風邪にかかった
I took cold―caught cold.
風邪にかかっている
I have a cold.
熱病にかかった
I caught a fever―sickened of a fever.
熱病にかかっている
I have a fever―I am suffering from a fever―ill with a fever.
子どもが麻疹にかかった
The child caught the measles.
麻疹にかかっている
He has the measles.
疱瘡にかかった
He was attacked with the smallpox.
疱瘡にかかっている
He has an attack of the smallpox.
疱瘡にかかって治ったばかりだ
He has just recovered from an attack of the smallpox.
泥水を飲んで赤痢にかかった者がある
Some people were attacked with dysentery from drinking muddy water.
彼は肺病にかかっている
He is suffering from consumption―afflicted with consumption.
僕は不眠症にかかっている
I am suffering from insomnia―troubled with insomnia.
微恙にかかっている
I am slightly indisposed.
彼は満洲でその病気にかかって来た
He contracted the disease in Manchuria.
卒中にかかった
He was stricken with apoplexy―He had a stroke of apoplexy.
病にかかりやすい
to be sensitive to diseases―susceptible to diseases
肺病にかかりやすい体質の人がある
Some constitutions are predisposed to consumption―Some men are of consumptive diathesis.
病にかかって倒れる
to die of a disease―succumb to a disease―fall a prey to a disease
流行性感冒にかかって倒れた者がたくさんある
Many people succumbed to influenza.
病にかからぬ
to be proof against diseases―immune from a disease
平生養生すれば病にかからぬ
Be careful of your health, and you will escape illness―keep the doctor away.
医者にかかる
to consult a doctor―have a doctor―see the doctor―take medical advice―receive medical treatment
医者にかかっている
I am under the treatment of a doctor―under medical treatment.
歯医者にかかっている
I am under the hands of a dentist.
医者にかかったか
Have you had a doctor?
早速医者にかかるがよい
You ought to see the doctor at once―You ought to lose no time in taking medical advice.
僕は病気の時佐藤博士にかかった
I was under the treatment of Dr. Sato in my illness.
あの医者にかかっても少しもよくならない
I am none the better for his treatment.
医者にかかるほどの病気でない
My illness does not need medical treatment.
彼は人手にかかって死んだ
He died by the hand of his enemy.
刃にかかって倒れた
He fell beneath the sword.
彼らは日本兵の銃剣にかかって倒れた
They fell beneath the Japanese bayonet.
彼は刺客の毒手にかかった
He fell a victim to the dagger of an assassin―became the victim of an assassin.
あの人間の手にかかってはたいへんだ
It would be death to fall into his hands―to place yourself in his power.
小高利貸の手にかかった
I fell into the clutches of a usurer.
彼は悪者どもの手にかかって所持金をまき上げられた
He fell among thieves, and was done out of his money.
男はあの女の手にかかっては赤ん坊あしらいだ
A man is a baby in her hands.
皆試験官の手にかかる
All are handed over to the tender mercies of the examiner.
河に橋が架かる
A bridge is built over a river―thrown across a river.
河に橋が架かっている
There is a bridge over the river―There is a bridge across the river―A bridge crosses the river―A bridge spans the river―The river is spanned by a bridge―The river is bridged.
鉄道がかかる
A railway is laid.
ここへも今に鉄道がかかります
A railway will be extended here very soon―The place will soon be brought into railway communication.
税がかかる
A tax is laid on an article―imposed on an article.
酒やタバコには重い税がかかる
Heavy taxes are imposed on wine and tobacco.
税は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.
水がかかる
Water falls on anything―to be splashed with water.
着物にしぶきがかかった
The spray fell on my clothes―My clothes were exposed to the spray.
雨がかかる
to be exposed to the rain
雨がかかると色がさめる
The colour will fade if it is exposed to the rain.
そこは雨がかかるからこちらへお入り
You are standing in the rain. Come in out of the wet.
気にかかる
to weigh on one's mind
この借金が気にかかる
This debt weighs on my mind―This debt is a weight on my mind.
電話がかかって来る
I am called up (to the telephone)―rung up (on the telephone).
君に電話がかかって来たよ
There is a call for you on the telephone―You are wanted at the telephone.
田中さんから電話がかかって来た
Mr. Tanaka wants you at the telephone―Mr. Tanaka has rung for you.
電報がかかって来た
A telegram has come.
嫌疑がかかる
Suspicion falls on one―One falls under suspicion.
会計に嫌疑がかかった
Suspicion rested on the treasurer―The treasurer fell under suspicion.
この所有権に疑いがかかっている
Doubt hangs over the title―There is a cloud on the title.
声がかかる
Some one calls to me―shouts to me.
殿のお声がかかる
My lord commands.
大臣のお声がかかる
The Minister recommends some one to the office.
号令がかかる
The word of command is given.
号令がかかると生徒が起立する
The students rise at the word of command.
人目にかかる
to attract attention―attract notice―be discovered
人目にかからぬそのうちに早くこの場を立去れ
Leave the place in haste before you are discovered.
僕の目にかかったが最後、断じて逃がしはせぬ
If I catch sight of him, he shall not escape me.
あなたには一度お目にかかりました
I had the pleasure of seeing you once.
そのかたにはお目にかかったことはありません
I never set eyes on him.
それがうまくいったらお目にかからない
I am damned if it succeeds―I am blest if it succeeds.
目方が(いくら)かかる
to weigh so much
大きな鰻は三百匁{もんめ}もかかる
A large eel will weigh three pounds―weigh no less than three pounds.
東北人は言葉が鼻にかかる
The people from the North-East speak through the nose.
(釣りをしていて)魚がかかった
I have got a bite―I have a bite.
人にかかる
to attack one―fall on one
彼は僕に喰ってかかって来た
He turned on me in anger.
誰でもかかれ、己が相手になってやる
Let any one come on, I am his man.
船が繋かる
A ship anchors―comes to anchor.
港には船がかかっている
Ships are at anchor―Ships lie at anchor―Ships ride at anchor―in the harbour.
汽船は桟橋にかかっている
The steamer is lying alongside the pier.
糸によりがかかる
The threads get a firmer twist.
糸によりがかかっている
The threads are hard as nails.
口がかかる
to be called―be offered an engagement―have a position offered one
お座敷がかかる
A geisha is offered an engagement.
山路にかかる
to approach a mountain
箸にも棒にもかからぬ奴だ
He is a reprobate ―He is past praying for.

content:
32. 
〈Passive〉

content.content: 電話は米国人の発明にかかる
The telephone was invented by an American.
この機械は彼の発明にかかる
This machine is of his invention.
縄目にかかる
to be bound―be put in bonds
神妙に縄にかかれ
Suffer yourself to be bound.
盗難にかかる
to be robbed
詐欺にかかる
to be swindled
ペテンにかかって金を取られた
I was swindled out of my money.
火災にかかる
to be destroyed by fire
全都兵火にかかる
The whole city was destroyed by fire in the war.
電気がかかる
to be electrified―be charged with electricity
鉄条網には電気がかかっていた
The wire-entanglements were charged with electricity.

content: 〈接尾動詞〉(=すんでのことに)nearly

content.content: 殺されかかった
I was very nearly killed―I came near being killed.
彼は死にかかっている
He is dying.

content:
かかる〔掛かる、懸かる、罹る、係る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=ぶらさがる)to hang; to be hung

content.content: 壁に地図が掛かっている
A map hangs on the wall.
壁に鉄砲がかかっている
A gun hangs against the wall.
釘に帽子がかかっている
A hat hangs on the peg.
机の上にランプがかかっている
A lamp hang over the table.
門に看板がかかっている
A signboard hangs over the door.
君の帽子は帽子掛けにかかっている
Your hat hangs on the peg.
西の空に新月がかかっている
The new moon hangs in the western sky.
壁に額がかかっている
(額を主とすれば)A picture hangs on the wall―(壁を主とすれば)―The wall is hung with pictures.
床の間に掛け物がかかっている
A scroll hangs in the alcove―The alcove is hung with a scroll.
窓に幕がかかっている
The window is hung with a curtain.
頂上に雲がかかっている
A cloud hangs over the summit.
月に雲がかかっている
The moon is behind a cloud.
太陽に雲がかかっている
The sun is obscured (by a cloud).

content: 2. (=寄り掛かる)to lean (against the wall ―on a desk); to bear (against the wall ―on the posts)

content.content: 椅子に掛かる
to sit on a chair―sit in a chair
屋根に梯子が掛かっている
A ladder stands against the roof.
肩にかかる
to lie on one's shoulders―rest on one's shoulders―fall on one's shoulders
全責任が僕の双肩にかかる
The whole responsibility rests on my shoulders.
入費が皆僕にかかる
All the expenses fall on me.
親が死ぬと借金が子どもにかかる
When a father dies, his debts devolve on his son.
負担は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.

content: 3. (=たよる)to depend on (something); to hang on (something)

content.content: 彼はまだ親にかかっている
He is still dependent on his father.
未亡人は行く末あの男の子にかかるつもりだ
The widow intends to depend on her boy in her old age―She looks to her boy for support in her old age.
我が国の運は青年諸子の将来の努力にかかっている
The destiny of the nation depends upon your future efforts, young men!
彼の生命は一にかかって君の判決にあり
His life hangs upon your decision.

content: 4. (=引っかかる)to catch; to be caught

content.content: 凧が電線にかかった
The kite has caught on a telegraph wire.
死体は橋杭にかかっていた
The body was caught on a pile.
釘に着物がかかった
A nail caught my clothes―My clothes caught on a nail.
網にかかる
to be caught in a net
魚が網にかかる
Fish are caught in a net.
法網にかかる
to fall into the clutches of the law―fall into the meshes of the law
係蹄{わな}にかかる
to fall into a trap―fall into a snare
鍵がかからぬ
The key will not catch.

content: 5. (=陥る)to fall into (a trap, etc.)

content.content: 敵の計略にかかる
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap
悪計にかかる
to fall a victim to a scheme
君は悪漢の計略にかかったのだ
You have fallen a victim to the schemes of a knave.

content: 6. (=係わる)to relate to (anything); to concern (one); to affect (anything)

content.content: この関係代名詞は何にかかのるか
What does this relative pronoun relate to?
これをしなけりゃ僕の面目にかかわる(顔に係る、名誉に関する)
It concerns my honour―It is a point of honour with me―to do this.
これは首にかかる問題だ
The matter concerns my life―It is a hanging matter―It is a life-or-death question.
命にかかる
to concern one's life―endanger one's life
命にかかる病だ
It is a fatal disease.
この病は命にはかからぬ
The disease is not fatal.
命にかかる傷だ
It is a mortal wound―(けがなら)―a fatal injury.
国民一般にかかる問題だ
The question concerns the whole nation.
海運は国運にかかる
Marine transportation affects the national prosperity.

content: 7. (=取り掛かる)to set about (one's task); to go to work; to fall to work; to set to work; to turn to work; to proceed to business; to begin (doing something); to be going to (do something); to be about to (do something); to be engaged in (some work); to be occupied with (some work); to be engaged on (a new work); to have (a work) in hand

content.content: もう普請にかかっている
They have begun building the house.
早速仕事にかかろう
I will set about my task at once.
早速議事にかかります
We shall proceed to business at once.
朝起きるとすぐ仕事にかかる
I go to work―set to work―turn to work―as soon as I get up.
彼は著述にかかっている
He is engaged in literary work―occupied with literary work.
字書の編纂にかかっている
He is engaged in compiling a dictionary―occupied in compiling a dictionary.
新著述にかかっている
He is engaged on a new work―He has a new work in hand.
その仕事にはまだかかっていない
The work is not yet in hand.
この本を読みかかっている
I am going to read this book―about to read this book.
その人は死にかかっていた
He was dying―He lay at the point of death.
花は開きかかっている
The flowers are opening.
本は今印刷にかかっている
The book is printing―in the press.
大工は今屋根にかかっている
The carpenters are working at the roof.
その仕事に十人かかっている
Ten men are engaged on the work.
大勢かかってやっと仕事をし終った
The work has at last been completed among many men―by the united efforts of many men.
たすきがけでかかる
to buckle to one's task
茶にしてかかる
to trifle with one's task―make light of one's task

いくら金がかかるか

It will cost you nothing.

この船を操縦するのに何人かかるか

この家は一万円かかった

A bridge is built over a river―thrown across a river.
河に橋が架かっている
There is a bridge over the river―There is a bridge across the river―A bridge crosses the river―A bridge spans the river―The river is spanned by a bridge―The river is bridged.
鉄道がかかる
A railway is laid.
ここへも今に鉄道がかかります
A railway will be extended here very soon―The place will soon be brought into railway communication.
税がかかる
A tax is laid on an article―imposed on an article.
酒やタバコには重い税がかかる
Heavy taxes are imposed on wine and tobacco.
税は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.
水がかかる
Water falls on anything―to be splashed with water.
着物にしぶきがかかった
The spray fell on my clothes―My clothes were exposed to the spray.
雨がかかる
to be exposed to the rain
雨がかかると色がさめる
The colour will fade if it is exposed to the rain.
そこは雨がかかるからこちらへお入り
You are standing in the rain. Come in out of the wet.
気にかかる
to weigh on one's mind
この借金が気にかかる
This debt weighs on my mind―This debt is a weight on my mind.
電話がかかって来る
I am called up (to the telephone)―rung up (on the telephone).
君に電話がかかって来たよ
There is a call for you on the telephone―You are wanted at the telephone.
田中さんから電話がかかって来た
Mr. Tanaka wants you at the telephone―Mr. Tanaka has rung for you.
電報がかかって来た
A telegram has come.
嫌疑がかかる
Suspicion falls on one―One falls under suspicion.
会計に嫌疑がかかった
Suspicion rested on the treasurer―The treasurer fell under suspicion.
この所有権に疑いがかかっている
Doubt hangs over the title―There is a cloud on the title.
声がかかる
Some one calls to me―shouts to me.
殿のお声がかかる
My lord commands.
大臣のお声がかかる
The Minister recommends some one to the office.
号令がかかる
The word of command is given.
号令がかかると生徒が起立する
The students rise at the word of command.
人目にかかる
to attract attention―attract notice―be discovered
人目にかからぬそのうちに早くこの場を立去れ
Leave the place in haste before you are discovered.
僕の目にかかったが最後、断じて逃がしはせぬ
If I catch sight of him, he shall not escape me.
あなたには一度お目にかかりました
I had the pleasure of seeing you once.
そのかたにはお目にかかったことはありません
I never set eyes on him.
それがうまくいったらお目にかからない
I am damned if it succeeds―I am blest if it succeeds.
目方が(いくら)かかる
to weigh so much
大きな鰻は三百匁{もんめ}もかかる
A large eel will weigh three pounds―weigh no less than three pounds.
東北人は言葉が鼻にかかる
The people from the North-East speak through the nose.
(釣りをしていて)魚がかかった
I have got a bite―I have a bite.
人にかかる
to attack one―fall on one
彼は僕に喰ってかかって来た
He turned on me in anger.
誰でもかかれ、己が相手になってやる
Let any one come on, I am his man.
船が繋かる
A ship anchors―comes to anchor.
港には船がかかっている
Ships are at anchor―Ships lie at anchor―Ships ride at anchor―in the harbour.
汽船は桟橋にかかっている
The steamer is lying alongside the pier.
糸によりがかかる
The threads get a firmer twist.
糸によりがかかっている
The threads are hard as nails.
口がかかる
to be called―be offered an engagement―have a position offered one
お座敷がかかる
A geisha is offered an engagement.
山路にかかる
to approach a mountain
箸にも棒にもかからぬ奴だ
He is a reprobate ―He is past praying for.

content:
32. 
〈Passive〉

content.content: 電話は米国人の発明にかかる
The telephone was invented by an American.
この機械は彼の発明にかかる
This machine is of his invention.
縄目にかかる
to be bound―be put in bonds
神妙に縄にかかれ
Suffer yourself to be bound.
盗難にかかる
to be robbed
詐欺にかかる
to be swindled
ペテンにかかって金を取られた
I was swindled out of my money.
火災にかかる
to be destroyed by fire
全都兵火にかかる
The whole city was destroyed by fire in the war.
電気がかかる
to be electrified―be charged with electricity
鉄条網には電気がかかっていた
The wire-entanglements were charged with electricity.

content: 〈接尾動詞〉(=すんでのことに)nearly

content.content: 殺されかかった
I was very nearly killed―I came near being killed.
彼は死にかかっている
He is dying.

content:
かかる〔掛かる、懸かる、罹る、係る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=ぶらさがる)to hang; to be hung

content.content: 壁に地図が掛かっている
A map hangs on the wall.
壁に鉄砲がかかっている
A gun hangs against the wall.
釘に帽子がかかっている
A hat hangs on the peg.
机の上にランプがかかっている
A lamp hang over the table.
門に看板がかかっている
A signboard hangs over the door.
君の帽子は帽子掛けにかかっている
Your hat hangs on the peg.
西の空に新月がかかっている
The new moon hangs in the western sky.
壁に額がかかっている
(額を主とすれば)A picture hangs on the wall―(壁を主とすれば)―The wall is hung with pictures.
床の間に掛け物がかかっている
A scroll hangs in the alcove―The alcove is hung with a scroll.
窓に幕がかかっている
The window is hung with a curtain.
頂上に雲がかかっている
A cloud hangs over the summit.
月に雲がかかっている
The moon is behind a cloud.
太陽に雲がかかっている
The sun is obscured (by a cloud).

content: 2. (=寄り掛かる)to lean (against the wall ―on a desk); to bear (against the wall ―on the posts)

content.content: 椅子に掛かる
to sit on a chair―sit in a chair
屋根に梯子が掛かっている
A ladder stands against the roof.
肩にかかる
to lie on one's shoulders―rest on one's shoulders―fall on one's shoulders
全責任が僕の双肩にかかる
The whole responsibility rests on my shoulders.
入費が皆僕にかかる
All the expenses fall on me.
親が死ぬと借金が子どもにかかる
When a father dies, his debts devolve on his son.
負担は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.

content: 3. (=たよる)to depend on (something); to hang on (something)

content.content: 彼はまだ親にかかっている
He is still dependent on his father.
未亡人は行く末あの男の子にかかるつもりだ
The widow intends to depend on her boy in her old age―She looks to her boy for support in her old age.
我が国の運は青年諸子の将来の努力にかかっている
The destiny of the nation depends upon your future efforts, young men!
彼の生命は一にかかって君の判決にあり
His life hangs upon your decision.

content: 4. (=引っかかる)to catch; to be caught

content.content: 凧が電線にかかった
The kite has caught on a telegraph wire.
死体は橋杭にかかっていた
The body was caught on a pile.
釘に着物がかかった
A nail caught my clothes―My clothes caught on a nail.
網にかかる
to be caught in a net
魚が網にかかる
Fish are caught in a net.
法網にかかる
to fall into the clutches of the law―fall into the meshes of the law
係蹄{わな}にかかる
to fall into a trap―fall into a snare
鍵がかからぬ
The key will not catch.

content: 5. (=陥る)to fall into (a trap, etc.)

content.content: 敵の計略にかかる
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap
悪計にかかる
to fall a victim to a scheme
君は悪漢の計略にかかったのだ
You have fallen a victim to the schemes of a knave.

content: 6. (=係わる)to relate to (anything); to concern (one); to affect (anything)

content.content: この関係代名詞は何にかかのるか
What does this relative pronoun relate to?
これをしなけりゃ僕の面目にかかわる(顔に係る、名誉に関する)
It concerns my honour―It is a point of honour with me―to do this.
これは首にかかる問題だ
The matter concerns my life―It is a hanging matter―It is a life-or-death question.
命にかかる
to concern one's life―endanger one's life
命にかかる病だ
It is a fatal disease.
この病は命にはかからぬ
The disease is not fatal.
命にかかる傷だ
It is a mortal wound―(けがなら)―a fatal injury.
国民一般にかかる問題だ
The question concerns the whole nation.
海運は国運にかかる
Marine transportation affects the national prosperity.

content: 7. (=取り掛かる)to set about (one's task); to go to work; to fall to work; to set to work; to turn to work; to proceed to business; to begin (doing something); to be going to (do something); to be about to (do something); to be engaged in (some work); to be occupied with (some work); to be engaged on (a new work); to have (a work) in hand

content.content: もう普請にかかっている
They have begun building the house.
早速仕事にかかろう
I will set about my task at once.
早速議事にかかります
We shall proceed to business at once.
朝起きるとすぐ仕事にかかる
I go to work―set to work―turn to work―as soon as I get up.
彼は著述にかかっている
He is engaged in literary work―occupied with literary work.
字書の編纂にかかっている
He is engaged in compiling a dictionary―occupied in compiling a dictionary.
新著述にかかっている
He is engaged on a new work―He has a new work in hand.
その仕事にはまだかかっていない
The work is not yet in hand.
この本を読みかかっている
I am going to read this book―about to read this book.
その人は死にかかっていた
He was dying―He lay at the point of death.
花は開きかかっている
The flowers are opening.
本は今印刷にかかっている
The book is printing―in the press.
大工は今屋根にかかっている
The carpenters are working at the roof.
その仕事に十人かかっている
Ten men are engaged on the work.
大勢かかってやっと仕事をし終った
The work has at last been completed among many men―by the united efforts of many men.
たすきがけでかかる
to buckle to one's task
茶にしてかかる
to trifle with one's task―make light of one's task

content: 8. (=要する)to require (trouble); to take (time or men); to cost (money or labour); to involve (expense)

content.content: どのくらい日数(年数)がかかるか
How long will it take?
いくら金がかかるか
What will it cost?
一文もかからぬ
It will cost you nothing.
何人かかるか
How many men will it take?
この船を操縦するのに何人かかるか
How many men does it take to work this ship?
英語を修めるに十年かかる
It takes ten years to master English.
僕は英語を修めるに十年かかった
It took me ten years to master English―I took ten years to master English―I was ten years in mastering English.
そんな家を造るには一万円はかかる
Such a house will cost 10,000 yen.
この家は一万円かかった
This house cost me 10,000 yen.
この本を書くのに三年かかった
It took me three years to write this book―The book cost me three years' labour.
戦争をすると金がかかる
War costs money.
訴訟を起こすと入費がかかる
A lawsuit involves expense.
訴訟は手数がかかる
A lawsuit requires much trouble.
旅行は費用がかかる
Travelling involves expense―Travelling is expensive.
費用はいくらかかっても洋行する
I will go abroad whatever it may cost―cost what it may―regardless of expense.
軍艦を造るには莫大の金がかかる
Warships cost enormous sums of money.
よほど手のかかった品だ
The article must have cost a great deal of labour.
君の病気は今月いっぱいかかる
It will take you all this month to recover from your illness.
この病気は長くかかる
It takes long to recover from this disease―It is a lingering disease.
彼は全快するにはまだ暫くかかる
It will take him some time to get well―(と言うよりも普通)―It will be some time before he gets well.
全快までには二三週間はかかる(二三週間経たなけりゃ全快せぬ)
It will be some weeks before he gets well.
僕のところは学校へ五分かからぬ
I live within five minutes' walk of the school.
病にかかる
to be taken ill―be seized with an illness―be attacked with a disease―contract a disease
病にかかっている
I am suffering from an illness―afflicted with a disease―troubled with a disease.
誰か急病にかかった
Somebody was suddenly taken ill―seized with a sudden illness.
彼は洋行中病気にかかった
He was taken ill―seized with an illness―while abroad.
肺炎にかかった
He was attacked with pneumonia.
今肺炎にかかっている
He has an attack of pneumonia―He is suffering from pneumonia.
流行性感冒にかかった
I was attacked with influenza.
流行性感冒にかかっている
I have an attack of influenza―I am suffering from influenza.
流行性感冒にかかって寝ている
I am laid up with an attack of influenza.
流行性感冒にかかっている者がたくさんある
Many people are suffering from influenza―There are many cases of influenza.
風邪にかかった
I took cold―caught cold.
風邪にかかっている
I have a cold.
熱病にかかった
I caught a fever―sickened of a fever.
熱病にかかっている
I have a fever―I am suffering from a fever―ill with a fever.
子どもが麻疹にかかった
The child caught the measles.
麻疹にかかっている
He has the measles.
疱瘡にかかった
He was attacked with the smallpox.
疱瘡にかかっている
He has an attack of the smallpox.
疱瘡にかかって治ったばかりだ
He has just recovered from an attack of the smallpox.
泥水を飲んで赤痢にかかった者がある
Some people were attacked with dysentery from drinking muddy water.
彼は肺病にかかっている
He is suffering from consumption―afflicted with consumption.
僕は不眠症にかかっている
I am suffering from insomnia―troubled with insomnia.
微恙にかかっている
I am slightly indisposed.
彼は満洲でその病気にかかって来た
He contracted the disease in Manchuria.
卒中にかかった
He was stricken with apoplexy―He had a stroke of apoplexy.
病にかかりやすい
to be sensitive to diseases―susceptible to diseases
肺病にかかりやすい体質の人がある
Some constitutions are predisposed to consumption―Some men are of consumptive diathesis.
病にかかって倒れる
to die of a disease―succumb to a disease―fall a prey to a disease
流行性感冒にかかって倒れた者がたくさんある
Many people succumbed to influenza.
病にかからぬ
to be proof against diseases―immune from a disease
平生養生すれば病にかからぬ
Be careful of your health, and you will escape illness―keep the doctor away.
医者にかかる
to consult a doctor―have a doctor―see the doctor―take medical advice―receive medical treatment
医者にかかっている
I am under the treatment of a doctor―under medical treatment.
歯医者にかかっている
I am under the hands of a dentist.
医者にかかったか
Have you had a doctor?
早速医者にかかるがよい
You ought to see the doctor at once―You ought to lose no time in taking medical advice.
僕は病気の時佐藤博士にかかった
I was under the treatment of Dr. Sato in my illness.
あの医者にかかっても少しもよくならない
I am none the better for his treatment.
医者にかかるほどの病気でない
My illness does not need medical treatment.
彼は人手にかかって死んだ
He died by the hand of his enemy.
刃にかかって倒れた
He fell beneath the sword.
彼らは日本兵の銃剣にかかって倒れた
They fell beneath the Japanese bayonet.
彼は刺客の毒手にかかった
He fell a victim to the dagger of an assassin―became the victim of an assassin.
あの人間の手にかかってはたいへんだ
It would be death to fall into his hands―to place yourself in his power.
小高利貸の手にかかった
I fell into the clutches of a usurer.
彼は悪者どもの手にかかって所持金をまき上げられた
He fell among thieves, and was done out of his money.
男はあの女の手にかかっては赤ん坊あしらいだ
A man is a baby in her hands.
皆試験官の手にかかる
All are handed over to the tender mercies of the examiner.
河に橋が架かる
A bridge is built over a river―thrown across a river.
河に橋が架かっている
There is a bridge over the river―There is a bridge across the river―A bridge crosses the river―A bridge spans the river―The river is spanned by a bridge―The river is bridged.
鉄道がかかる
A railway is laid.
ここへも今に鉄道がかかります
A railway will be extended here very soon―The place will soon be brought into railway communication.
税がかかる
A tax is laid on an article―imposed on an article.
酒やタバコには重い税がかかる
Heavy taxes are imposed on wine and tobacco.
税は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.
水がかかる
Water falls on anything―to be splashed with water.
着物にしぶきがかかった
The spray fell on my clothes―My clothes were exposed to the spray.
雨がかかる
to be exposed to the rain
雨がかかると色がさめる
The colour will fade if it is exposed to the rain.
そこは雨がかかるからこちらへお入り
You are standing in the rain. Come in out of the wet.
気にかかる
to weigh on one's mind
この借金が気にかかる
This debt weighs on my mind―This debt is a weight on my mind.
電話がかかって来る
I am called up (to the telephone)―rung up (on the telephone).
君に電話がかかって来たよ
There is a call for you on the telephone―You are wanted at the telephone.
田中さんから電話がかかって来た
Mr. Tanaka wants you at the telephone―Mr. Tanaka has rung for you.
電報がかかって来た
A telegram has come.
嫌疑がかかる
Suspicion falls on one―One falls under suspicion.
会計に嫌疑がかかった
Suspicion rested on the treasurer―The treasurer fell under suspicion.
この所有権に疑いがかかっている
Doubt hangs over the title―There is a cloud on the title.
声がかかる
Some one calls to me―shouts to me.
殿のお声がかかる
My lord commands.
大臣のお声がかかる
The Minister recommends some one to the office.
号令がかかる
The word of command is given.
号令がかかると生徒が起立する
The students rise at the word of command.
人目にかかる
to attract attention―attract notice―be discovered
人目にかからぬそのうちに早くこの場を立去れ
Leave the place in haste before you are discovered.
僕の目にかかったが最後、断じて逃がしはせぬ
If I catch sight of him, he shall not escape me.
あなたには一度お目にかかりました
I had the pleasure of seeing you once.
そのかたにはお目にかかったことはありません
I never set eyes on him.
それがうまくいったらお目にかからない
I am damned if it succeeds―I am blest if it succeeds.
目方が(いくら)かかる
to weigh so much
大きな鰻は三百匁{もんめ}もかかる
A large eel will weigh three pounds―weigh no less than three pounds.
東北人は言葉が鼻にかかる
The people from the North-East speak through the nose.
(釣りをしていて)魚がかかった
I have got a bite―I have a bite.
人にかかる
to attack one―fall on one
彼は僕に喰ってかかって来た
He turned on me in anger.
誰でもかかれ、己が相手になってやる
Let any one come on, I am his man.
船が繋かる
A ship anchors―comes to anchor.
港には船がかかっている
Ships are at anchor―Ships lie at anchor―Ships ride at anchor―in the harbour.
汽船は桟橋にかかっている
The steamer is lying alongside the pier.
糸によりがかかる
The threads get a firmer twist.
糸によりがかかっている
The threads are hard as nails.
口がかかる
to be called―be offered an engagement―have a position offered one
お座敷がかかる
A geisha is offered an engagement.
山路にかかる
to approach a mountain
箸にも棒にもかからぬ奴だ
He is a reprobate ―He is past praying for.

content.content: 電話は米国人の発明にかかる

詐欺にかかる
to be swindled

to be destroyed by fire

屋根に梯子が掛かっている

content.content: 彼はまだ親にかかっている

未亡人は行く末あの男の子にかかるつもりだ
The widow intends to depend on her boy in her old age―She looks to her boy for support in her old age.

The destiny of the nation depends upon your future efforts, young men!
彼の生命は一にかかって君の判決にあり

content.content: 凧が電線にかかった
The kite has caught on a telegraph wire.
死体は橋杭にかかっていた
The body was caught on a pile.
釘に着物がかかった
A nail caught my clothes―My clothes caught on a nail.
網にかかる
to be caught in a net
魚が網にかかる
Fish are caught in a net.
法網にかかる
to fall into the clutches of the law―fall into the meshes of the law
係蹄{わな}にかかる
to fall into a trap―fall into a snare
鍵がかからぬ
The key will not catch.

content: 5. (=陥る)to fall into (a trap, etc.)

content.content: 敵の計略にかかる
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap
悪計にかかる
to fall a victim to a scheme
君は悪漢の計略にかかったのだ
You have fallen a victim to the schemes of a knave.

content: 6. (=係わる)to relate to (anything); to concern (one); to affect (anything)

content.content: この関係代名詞は何にかかのるか
What does this relative pronoun relate to?
これをしなけりゃ僕の面目にかかわる(顔に係る、名誉に関する)
It concerns my honour―It is a point of honour with me―to do this.
これは首にかかる問題だ
The matter concerns my life―It is a hanging matter―It is a life-or-death question.
命にかかる
to concern one's life―endanger one's life
命にかかる病だ
It is a fatal disease.
この病は命にはかからぬ
The disease is not fatal.
命にかかる傷だ
It is a mortal wound―(けがなら)―a fatal injury.
国民一般にかかる問題だ
The question concerns the whole nation.
海運は国運にかかる
Marine transportation affects the national prosperity.

content: 7. (=取り掛かる)to set about (one's task); to go to work; to fall to work; to set to work; to turn to work; to proceed to business; to begin (doing something); to be going to (do something); to be about to (do something); to be engaged in (some work); to be occupied with (some work); to be engaged on (a new work); to have (a work) in hand

content.content: もう普請にかかっている
They have begun building the house.
早速仕事にかかろう
I will set about my task at once.
早速議事にかかります
We shall proceed to business at once.
朝起きるとすぐ仕事にかかる
I go to work―set to work―turn to work―as soon as I get up.
彼は著述にかかっている
He is engaged in literary work―occupied with literary work.
字書の編纂にかかっている
He is engaged in compiling a dictionary―occupied in compiling a dictionary.
新著述にかかっている
He is engaged on a new work―He has a new work in hand.
その仕事にはまだかかっていない
The work is not yet in hand.
この本を読みかかっている
I am going to read this book―about to read this book.
その人は死にかかっていた
He was dying―He lay at the point of death.
花は開きかかっている
The flowers are opening.
本は今印刷にかかっている
The book is printing―in the press.
大工は今屋根にかかっている
The carpenters are working at the roof.
その仕事に十人かかっている
Ten men are engaged on the work.
大勢かかってやっと仕事をし終った
The work has at last been completed among many men―by the united efforts of many men.
たすきがけでかかる
to buckle to one's task
茶にしてかかる
to trifle with one's task―make light of one's task

content: 8. (=要する)to require (trouble); to take (time or men); to cost (money or labour); to involve (expense)

content.content: どのくらい日数(年数)がかかるか
How long will it take?
いくら金がかかるか
What will it cost?
一文もかからぬ
It will cost you nothing.
何人かかるか
How many men will it take?
この船を操縦するのに何人かかるか
How many men does it take to work this ship?
英語を修めるに十年かかる
It takes ten years to master English.
僕は英語を修めるに十年かかった
It took me ten years to master English―I took ten years to master English―I was ten years in mastering English.
そんな家を造るには一万円はかかる
Such a house will cost 10,000 yen.
この家は一万円かかった
This house cost me 10,000 yen.
この本を書くのに三年かかった
It took me three years to write this book―The book cost me three years' labour.
戦争をすると金がかかる
War costs money.
訴訟を起こすと入費がかかる
A lawsuit involves expense.
訴訟は手数がかかる
A lawsuit requires much trouble.
旅行は費用がかかる
Travelling involves expense―Travelling is expensive.
費用はいくらかかっても洋行する
I will go abroad whatever it may cost―cost what it may―regardless of expense.
軍艦を造るには莫大の金がかかる
Warships cost enormous sums of money.
よほど手のかかった品だ
The article must have cost a great deal of labour.
君の病気は今月いっぱいかかる
It will take you all this month to recover from your illness.
この病気は長くかかる
It takes long to recover from this disease―It is a lingering disease.
彼は全快するにはまだ暫くかかる
It will take him some time to get well―(と言うよりも普通)―It will be some time before he gets well.
全快までには二三週間はかかる(二三週間経たなけりゃ全快せぬ)
It will be some weeks before he gets well.
僕のところは学校へ五分かからぬ
I live within five minutes' walk of the school.
病にかかる
to be taken ill―be seized with an illness―be attacked with a disease―contract a disease
病にかかっている
I am suffering from an illness―afflicted with a disease―troubled with a disease.
誰か急病にかかった
Somebody was suddenly taken ill―seized with a sudden illness.
彼は洋行中病気にかかった
He was taken ill―seized with an illness―while abroad.
肺炎にかかった
He was attacked with pneumonia.
今肺炎にかかっている
He has an attack of pneumonia―He is suffering from pneumonia.
流行性感冒にかかった
I was attacked with influenza.
流行性感冒にかかっている
I have an attack of influenza―I am suffering from influenza.
流行性感冒にかかって寝ている
I am laid up with an attack of influenza.
流行性感冒にかかっている者がたくさんある
Many people are suffering from influenza―There are many cases of influenza.
風邪にかかった
I took cold―caught cold.
風邪にかかっている
I have a cold.
熱病にかかった
I caught a fever―sickened of a fever.
熱病にかかっている
I have a fever―I am suffering from a fever―ill with a fever.
子どもが麻疹にかかった
The child caught the measles.
麻疹にかかっている
He has the measles.
疱瘡にかかった
He was attacked with the smallpox.
疱瘡にかかっている
He has an attack of the smallpox.
疱瘡にかかって治ったばかりだ
He has just recovered from an attack of the smallpox.
泥水を飲んで赤痢にかかった者がある
Some people were attacked with dysentery from drinking muddy water.
彼は肺病にかかっている
He is suffering from consumption―afflicted with consumption.
僕は不眠症にかかっている
I am suffering from insomnia―troubled with insomnia.
微恙にかかっている
I am slightly indisposed.
彼は満洲でその病気にかかって来た
He contracted the disease in Manchuria.
卒中にかかった
He was stricken with apoplexy―He had a stroke of apoplexy.
病にかかりやすい
to be sensitive to diseases―susceptible to diseases
肺病にかかりやすい体質の人がある
Some constitutions are predisposed to consumption―Some men are of consumptive diathesis.
病にかかって倒れる
to die of a disease―succumb to a disease―fall a prey to a disease
流行性感冒にかかって倒れた者がたくさんある
Many people succumbed to influenza.
病にかからぬ
to be proof against diseases―immune from a disease
平生養生すれば病にかからぬ
Be careful of your health, and you will escape illness―keep the doctor away.
医者にかかる
to consult a doctor―have a doctor―see the doctor―take medical advice―receive medical treatment
医者にかかっている
I am under the treatment of a doctor―under medical treatment.
歯医者にかかっている
I am under the hands of a dentist.
医者にかかったか
Have you had a doctor?
早速医者にかかるがよい
You ought to see the doctor at once―You ought to lose no time in taking medical advice.
僕は病気の時佐藤博士にかかった
I was under the treatment of Dr. Sato in my illness.
あの医者にかかっても少しもよくならない
I am none the better for his treatment.
医者にかかるほどの病気でない
My illness does not need medical treatment.
彼は人手にかかって死んだ
He died by the hand of his enemy.
刃にかかって倒れた
He fell beneath the sword.
彼らは日本兵の銃剣にかかって倒れた
They fell beneath the Japanese bayonet.
彼は刺客の毒手にかかった
He fell a victim to the dagger of an assassin―became the victim of an assassin.
あの人間の手にかかってはたいへんだ
It would be death to fall into his hands―to place yourself in his power.
小高利貸の手にかかった
I fell into the clutches of a usurer.
彼は悪者どもの手にかかって所持金をまき上げられた
He fell among thieves, and was done out of his money.
男はあの女の手にかかっては赤ん坊あしらいだ
A man is a baby in her hands.
皆試験官の手にかかる
All are handed over to the tender mercies of the examiner.
河に橋が架かる
A bridge is built over a river―thrown across a river.
河に橋が架かっている
There is a bridge over the river―There is a bridge across the river―A bridge crosses the river―A bridge spans the river―The river is spanned by a bridge―The river is bridged.
鉄道がかかる
A railway is laid.
ここへも今に鉄道がかかります
A railway will be extended here very soon―The place will soon be brought into railway communication.
税がかかる
A tax is laid on an article―imposed on an article.
酒やタバコには重い税がかかる
Heavy taxes are imposed on wine and tobacco.
税は各階級に一様にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all classes.
水がかかる
Water falls on anything―to be splashed with water.
着物にしぶきがかかった
The spray fell on my clothes―My clothes were exposed to the spray.
雨がかかる
to be exposed to the rain
雨がかかると色がさめる
The colour will fade if it is exposed to the rain.
そこは雨がかかるからこちらへお入り
You are standing in the rain. Come in out of the wet.
気にかかる
to weigh on one's mind
この借金が気にかかる
This debt weighs on my mind―This debt is a weight on my mind.
電話がかかって来る
I am called up (to the telephone)―rung up (on the telephone).
君に電話がかかって来たよ
There is a call for you on the telephone―You are wanted at the telephone.
田中さんから電話がかかって来た
Mr. Tanaka wants you at the telephone―Mr. Tanaka has rung for you.
電報がかかって来た
A telegram has come.
嫌疑がかかる
Suspicion falls on one―One falls under suspicion.
会計に嫌疑がかかった
Suspicion rested on the treasurer―The treasurer fell under suspicion.
この所有権に疑いがかかっている
Doubt hangs over the title―There is a cloud on the title.
声がかかる
Some one calls to me―shouts to me.
殿のお声がかかる
My lord commands.
大臣のお声がかかる
The Minister recommends some one to the office.
号令がかかる
The word of command is given.
号令がかかると生徒が起立する
The students rise at the word of command.
人目にかかる
to attract attention―attract notice―be discovered
人目にかからぬそのうちに早くこの場を立去れ
Leave the place in haste before you are discovered.
僕の目にかかったが最後、断じて逃がしはせぬ
If I catch sight of him, he shall not escape me.
あなたには一度お目にかかりました
I had the pleasure of seeing you once.
そのかたにはお目にかかったことはありません
I never set eyes on him.
それがうまくいったらお目にかからない
I am damned if it succeeds―I am blest if it succeeds.
目方が(いくら)かかる
to weigh so much
大きな鰻は三百匁{もんめ}もかかる
A large eel will weigh three pounds―weigh no less than three pounds.
東北人は言葉が鼻にかかる
The people from the North-East speak through the nose.
(釣りをしていて)魚がかかった
I have got a bite―I have a bite.
人にかかる
to attack one―fall on one
彼は僕に喰ってかかって来た
He turned on me in anger.
誰でもかかれ、己が相手になってやる
Let any one come on, I am his man.
船が繋かる
A ship anchors―comes to anchor.
港には船がかかっている
Ships are at anchor―Ships lie at anchor―Ships ride at anchor―in the harbour.
汽船は桟橋にかかっている
The steamer is lying alongside the pier.
糸によりがかかる
The threads get a firmer twist.
糸によりがかかっている
The threads are hard as nails.
口がかかる
to be called―be offered an engagement―have a position offered one
お座敷がかかる
A geisha is offered an engagement.
山路にかかる
to approach a mountain
箸にも棒にもかからぬ奴だ
He is a reprobate ―He is past praying for.

content:
32. 
〈Passive〉

content.content: 電話は米国人の発明にかかる
The telephone was invented by an American.
この機械は彼の発明にかかる
This machine is of his invention.
縄目にかかる
to be bound―be put in bonds
神妙に縄にかかれ
Suffer yourself to be bound.
盗難にかかる
to be robbed
詐欺にかかる
to be swindled
ペテンにかかって金を取られた
I was swindled out of my money.
火災にかかる
to be destroyed by fire
全都兵火にかかる
The whole city was destroyed by fire in the war.
電気がかかる
to be electrified―be charged with electricity
鉄条網には電気がかかっていた
The wire-entanglements were charged with electricity.

content: 〈接尾動詞〉(=すんでのことに)nearly

content.content: 殺されかかった
I was very nearly killed―I came near being killed.
彼は死にかかっている
He is dying.

content:
かかる〔斯る〕
〈形〉Such

content.content: かかる場合にはどうすればよいものか
What should one do in such cases?―on such occasions?
かかる例は珍しくない
Such instances are very common.

かがる〔縢る〕
〈他動〉To darn; to sew; to cross-stitch

content:
かかわらず〔拘わらず〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=雖)notwithstanding; despite; in spite of; in defiance of; in the face of; in the teeth of; for all; with all; after all; none the less for

content.content: 雨天にかかわらず行った
I went notwithstanding the rain―I went in spite of the rain―The rain did not prevent my going.
病気にもかかわらず試験を受けた
I attended the examination in spite of my illness―My illness did not prevent my attending the examination.
彼は医者の注意にもかかわらず相変らず飲んでいる
He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.
これらの歴然たる証拠が上がったにもかかわらず彼は無罪を主張している
He protests his innocence in the face of these glaring facts.
彼らは反対があるにもかかわらず進んだ
We proceeded in the teeth of opposition.
日本の巡査ほど薄給にもかかわらすせ勤勉なものは無い
No one can be more diligent than the Japanese policeman in spite of his scanty pay.
あれほど金があるにもかかわらず彼はまだ満足しない
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
あれほど欠点があるにもかかわらず彼は偉い
With all his faults, he is a great man.
あれほど勉強したにもかかわらず彼は失敗した
He failed after all his labours.
彼には欠点があるにもかかわらず僕は彼を愛する
I love him none the less for his faults.

content: 2. (=関係せず)regardless of; irrespective of; without regard to; without reference to

content.content: 彼女は金銭にかかわらず奇羅を飾る
She gets herself up regardless of expense.
建築は費用にかかわらず堅牢を主とす
The strength of the building is the first consideration, regardless of expense.
後累のいかんにかかわらず本分を尽せ
Do your duty irrespective of the consequences.
良否にかかわらず品を受け取る
The goods are accepted irrespective of their quality.
老若男女にかかわらず採用する
All will be employed irrespective of age or sex―without distinction of age or sex.
彼らは功労の有無にかかわらず昇進するようだ
They seem to be promoted without regard to their merits―without reference to their merits.
晴雨にかかわらず遠足会を挙行す
The excursion will be held, regardless of the weather―in sunshine or in rain―rain or shine.

content: 〈接続詞〉Notwithstanding that; none the less because; although; whether; no matter how; however

content.content: 雨が降っていたにもかかわらず出発した
I started, notwithstanding that it was raining―although it was raining.
彼には欠点があるにもかかわらず彼を愛す
I love him none the less because he has faults―I love him, although he has faults―He has faults, nevertheless I love him―He has faults, but I do not love him the less.
多少に拘わらず御注文被下度候
We beg you will favour us with your orders, no matter how small they may be―however small.
年齢のいかんにかかわらず採用する
All will be employed whether they may be young or old.

content:
かかわる〔係わる、関わる、拘わる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=関する)to concern (one's honour); to involve (one's prestige); to affect (one's prosperity); to endanger (one's life)

content.content: 名誉にかかわることだ
The matter concerns my honour.
名誉にかかわるから弁明しておかねばならぬ
I must clear myself, for my honour is concerned―my honour is at stake.
一身上にかかわることだ
The matter concerns my welfare.
日本の威信にかかわる
Japan's prestige is involved.
命にかかわる
to endanger one's life
命のかかわる病だ
It is a fatal disease.
この病は命にはかかわらない
The disease is not fatal.
命にかかわる傷だ
It is a mortal wound―(は戦争の負傷、けがなら)―a fatal injury.
首にかかわる問題だ
The matter concerns my life―It is a hanging matter―It is a matter of life or death to me.
学校の繁栄にかかわることだ
The matter concerns the prosperity of the school―affects the prosperity of the school.

content: 2. (=関係する)to relate to (a matter)

content.content: 君の言うことは本件にはかかわらない
Your remark does not relate to the matter in hand―bear on the matter in hand.

content: 3. (=干与する、干渉する)to be concerned in (an affair); to concern oneself in (a matter); to interfere in (a matter); to meddle in (an affair); to have to do with (a matter)

content.content: 僕はこの事件にはかかわっていない
I am not concerned in the affair―I have no hand in the affair―I have nothing to do with the matter.
こんなことにかかわるのはまっぴらごめんだ
I do not wish to be concerned in such an affair―I will have no hand in such an affair―I wash my hands of the affair―I will have nothing to do with the matter.
こんなことにはかかわらぬがよい
You ought not to concern yourself in the matter―interfere in the matter―meddle in the affair.
君がかかわるとかえってぶちこわすから止せ
If you interfere in the matter, you will make a mess of it―Your interference will do more harm than good.

content: 4. (=拘泥する)to adhere to, stick to (anything)

content.content: こんな場合には規則にかかわっていられない
In such cases, we can not adhere to the rules.
小事にかかわって大事を怠るなかれ
Do not “strain at a gnat and swallow a camel.”→『かかわらず〔拘わらず〕』

content:
かかわる〔係わる、関わる、拘わる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=関する)to concern (one's honour); to involve (one's prestige); to affect (one's prosperity); to endanger (one's life)

content.content: 名誉にかかわることだ

名誉にかかわるから弁明しておかねばならぬ

日本の威信にかかわる

命にかかわる
to endanger one's life
命のかかわる病だ

この病は命にはかかわらない

content.content: 君の言うことは本件にはかかわらない

君がかかわるとかえってぶちこわすから止せ
If you interfere in the matter, you will make a mess of it―Your interference will do more harm than good.

content.content: こんな場合には規則にかかわっていられない
In such cases, we can not adhere to the rules.
小事にかかわって大事を怠るなかれ
Do not “strain at a gnat and swallow a camel.”→『かかわらず〔拘わらず〕』

content: 3. (=干与する、干渉する)to be concerned in (an affair); to concern oneself in (a matter); to interfere in (a matter); to meddle in (an affair); to have to do with (a matter)

content.content: 僕はこの事件にはかかわっていない

あんな奴にかきまわされてたまるものか
We won't stand having things tampered with by such a fellow.

content:
かきみだす〔掻き乱す〕
〈他動〉To throw (anything) into confusion; to throw (anything) into disorder; to derange, upset (one's plans); to ruffle, rumple, tousle (one's hair)

content.content: 砲弾が破裂して隊伍をかき乱した
A shell bursting threw the ranks into confusion.
女は頭髪をかき乱しておった
Her hair was ruffled―rumpled―tousled―She had dishevelled hair.
男は身形をかき乱しておった
He was in dishevelled dress―in tousled dress.
この事があったがために計画の順序をすっかりかき乱された
The matter has deranged all my plans―upset all my plans.

content:
かきみだれる〔掻き乱れる〕
〈自動〉To be confused; to be thrown into disorder

content.content: 頭髪がかき乱れている
Her hair is ruffled―rumpled―tousled―She has dishevelled hair.

content:
かきむしる〔掻きむしる〕
〈他動〉To tear (one's hair); to rend (one's hair); to harrow (one's feelings); to lacerate (one's heart)

content.content: 胸をかきむしる
to harrow one's feelings―lacerate one's heart
くわしく話を聞くと胸をかきむしられるようだった
I heard the harrowing details.
女の優しい目つきに心をかきむしられた
Her tender eyes made my blood tingle.

かきもち〔欠き餅〕
〈名〉Sliced and dried rice-cake

content:
かきもの〔書き物〕
〈名〉Writing:(=する) to write

content.content: 彼は机に向かって書き物をしておった
I found him writing at his desk.

かきもらす〔書き洩らす〕
〈他動〉To omit (anything) in writing; to leave out (anything); to miss (a word); to miss out (a sentence)

かきやく〔書き役〕
〈名〉An amanuensis; a copyist; a secretary

content:
かきゅう〔下級〕

content.content: 下級官吏
the lower officials
下級将校
a junior officer―a subaltern
下級裁判法
a lower law-court
下級生
a lower-class student
下級労働者
the low-class labourers

content:
かきゅう〔火急〕
〈名〉Urgency; exigency; emergency:(=の) exigent; urgent; pressing:(=に) in hot haste; hotfoot

content.content: 火急の用事があって来た
I come on urgent business―on pressing business.
この金は火急に要るのだ
The money is urgently needed.
百円ばかり火急の必要がある
I am in urgent need of 100 yen.
それでは火急の間に合わぬ
That would not meet the exigency.
火急に行って来た
I have been there hotfoot―in hot haste.
火急の場合に
in case of emergency―in an emergency
火急の場合に施す手段だ
It is an emergency measure.

content:
かぎゅう〔蝸牛〕
〈名〉The snail

content.content: 蝸牛角上の争い
a Lilliputian strife

かきょう〔佳境〕

content.content: がきょう〔佳境〕

content:
かきょう〔架橋〕
〈名〉Bridge-construction:(=する) to build a bridge over (a river); to throw a bridge across (a river); to bridge (a river)

content.content: 日本軍が敵前で架橋したのは偉い
It was bold of the Japanese to bridge the river in presence of the enemy.
架橋工事
bridge-construction works

content:
かぎょう〔家業〕
〈名〉(One's) trade, business, calling, vocation, occupation, profession

content.content: あの人の家業は何ですか
What is his trade?―What is his business?―What professions does he follow?―What calling does he pursue?―What is his vocation?
家業は大工だ
He is a carpenter by trade.
家業は医者だ
He is a physician by profession.
家業を営む
to work at one's trade―attend to one's business―carry on one's business
家業を励む
to give one's mind to one's business―give one's attention to one's business
家業を怠る
to neglect one's business
家業だから
Business is business.

content:
かぎょう〔課業〕
〈名〉A lesson; a task

content.content: 課業を励む
to be diligent in attending to one's lessons
課業を怠る
to neglect one's lessons
明日の課業を用意しなけりゃならぬ
I must prepare tomorrow's lessons―read up for tomorrow.
生徒は課業に忙しい
The boys are busy with their lessons―busy over their lessons.
課業が忙しいから遊ぶ暇が無い
They are too busy with their lessons to play.
課業が苦でなくなった
I have my lessons well in hand.
あの人は毎朝散歩するのを日々の課業にしている
He makes it his daily task to take a morning walk.

content:
がきょう〔佳境〕
〈名〉The best part, the cream (of anything)

content.content: 事佳境に入る
Now comes the cream of the thing.
談佳境に入る
The interest deepens―The plot thickens―Now comes the cream of the story.

かきょく〔歌曲〕
〈名〉An air; a tune; a song

かきよせ〔書き寄せ〕
〈名〉A collection; a compilation:(=る) to collect; to compile

content:
かぎり〔限り〕
〈名〉Bounds; limits; end

content.content: 人の力には限りがある
There are limits to man's power.
慾に限り無し
Avarice knows no bounds―Avarice knows no limits―There is no limit to avarice.
稽古は今日限り
School ends today.
限りある収入
a limited income
限り無き天地
the boundless universe

content: 〈形〉All ; every; last

content.content: 力のあらん限り働く
I work with all my might―with might and main.
あらん限りの力を出す
to put forth all one's strength
力に及ぶ限りの手を尽した
I have tried every means in my power.
彼らは命のあらん限り戦った
They fought to the last―to the last drop of their blood.
酒を飲むのはこれ限りだ
This is the last time I shall drink.

content: 〈副〉Only:(日限の限りは)not later than

content.content: この表面には宿所姓名を限り認むべし
White only the name and address on this side.
本校生徒に限り割引す
The prices are reduced for the students of this school only.
三十名を限り入学を許す
Thirty students only shall be admitted.
本提供は本月末日限りとす
This offer will hold good till the end of the current month only.
授業料は毎月三日限り納付すべし
The tuition-fee shall be paid not later than the 3rd of each month.

content: 〈接続詞〉As much as; as well as; as far as; as long as

content.content: 力に及ぶ限り努力せん
I shall endeavour as far as I can―as far as lies in my power―so far as in me lies―to the best of my ability.
僕は生きている限り働く
I will work as long as I live.
僕の知っている限りでは他に例は無い
This is the only case so far as I know―This is the only case to the best of my knowledge―There is no other case that I know of―There is no other case to my knowledge.
寡婦は事情の許す限り(どうかこうか)子どもを教育した
The widow educated her children so far as circumstances permitted―as well as she could under the circumstances―as best she might.
見渡す限り原は火の海と化した
The plain was a sea of fire as far as I could see―as far as the eye could reach.

content: 〈その他〉

content.content: 声の限り叫んだ
I should at the top of my voice―at the top of my lungs.
力のあらん限り走った
I ran at the top of my speed―I put my best foot foremost.
このたび限り私の言うことを聴いて下さい
Listen to me for this once!
今日限り暇を出す
I dismiss you from my service this very day.
今日限り禁酒する
I give up drinking from this day on.
彼は今日限りの命だ
He will not see another day.
見渡す限り我天下(孤島生活)
I am “monarch of all I survey.”
上を見れば限り無し
Greatness is comparative.
不足を言えば限り無し
There is no perfection in this world.
限り無き命
eternal life
願書は書式によらざる限りすべて無効とす
All applications that are not drawn up in due form shall be invalid.
紙面に限りあれば詳細にわたることを得ず
Want of space prevents our going into details.
この場限りの話しだが
Between you and me―Between ourselves,...
沙汰の限りである
It is absurd―preposterous―monstrous―outrageous―atrocious.
この限りにあらず
It is excepted―an exception.
次の場合はこの限りにあらず
The following cases are exceptions:―
ただし外人はこの限りにあらず
Foreigners, however, are excepted from the rule―excepted from the regulation―This rule, however, does not apply to foreigners.
説明の限りにあらず
Explanation may or may not be given―Explanation need not be given.
理由は説明の限りにあらず
The reason may or may not be given―There is no need of giving the reason.

content:
かぎりなき〔限り無き〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: むげん〔無限〕

content:
かぎる〔限る〕
〈他動〉To bound; to limit; to confine; to restrict; to circumscribe

content.content: この習慣は一地方に限られている
The custom is limited to a part of the country.
語学は一カ国に限るがよし
You should confine yourself to one language.
酒は医者からビール一本と限られた
My doctor has restricted me to one bottle of beer.
潜行艇の活動は狭い範囲内に限られる
The activity of the submarine is restricted within narrow limits―circumscribed.
各人の活動はその得手不得手のために限られる
Each man's activity is bounded by his limitations.
日限を限る
to limit the date

content: 〈助動詞〉Must; should

content.content: 保証人は戸主に限る
The surety must be a householder.
志願者は中学卒業生に限る
The candidate must have finished the middle school.
語学は若い時に限る
The study of languages should be begun early.

content: 〈副〉Only

content.content: この切符は一人一枚に限る
This ticket admits only one person.
中学卒業生に限り入学を許す
Those only are admitted who have finished the middle school.
三十名を限り入学を許す
Thirty students only shall be admitted.
貸間あり、ただし独身の紳士に限る
Apartments to let: single gentleman only need apply.
この表面には宿所姓名を限り認むべし
Write only the name and address on this side.
本校生徒に限り割引す
The prices are reduced for the students of this school only.

content:
〈特例〉
1. (=何に限る)nothing like; best; give me

content.content: 疲れた時は酒に限る
There is nothing like wine when one is tired.
花は一重に限る
There is nothing like single flowers.
食前は散歩するに限る
There is nothing like taking a walk before meals.
風景は松島に限る
For scenery, there is no place like Matsushima.
風邪には葛根湯に限る
For colds, there is nothing like Kakkonto.
君に限るよ
There is no one like you.
これに限る
There is nothing like this―This is the best thing.
ビールの肴はチーズに限る
Cheese is the best relish for beer.
あのような人は敬して遠ざけておくに限る
It is best to keep such men at a distance.
生意気な奴は凹ましておくに限る
There is nothing like snubbing a conceited fellow―It is best to snub a conceited fellow.
昔に限る(と老人は言う)
Give me the good old times!

content: 2. (=何々に限って)particular; certain

content.content: その日に限って便船が出なかった
The daily steamer did not sail on that particular day.
その晩に限って不在であった
I was away from home on that particular evening.
あの人に限って何故断るのか
What do you refuse that particular man?
いくつと数を限って食う
to eat a certain number
時間を限って問題を出す
The question must be answered within a certain time.
何故僕に限って許さないのですか
Why do you make an exception of me?
あの時に限って彼は主義を曲げた
For once he departed from his principles.
上にこびる者に限って下に横柄だ
Those who fawn upon their superiors, always lord it over their inferiors.
面前で人を賞める者に限って陰で悪口を言う
Those who praise you to your face, are sure to abuse you behind your back.

content: 3. (=誰に限ってそんなことはせぬ)the last person to do so

content.content: あの人に限ってそんなことはせぬ
He is the last man to do such a things.
あの人に限って嘘などはつかぬ
He is the last man to tell a lie.
君に限ってやりそこなうようなことはあるまいと思った
I thought you would be the last man to fail.
君に限ってそんなばかなことはしなかろうと思った
I thought you, of all men, must be free from such follies.

content: 4. (=何に限らず)whatever

content.content: 何事に限らず全力を尽せ
Whatever the matter may be,―Be the matter what it will―do your best.
彼がすることは何事に限らず成功する
He succeeds in whatever he undertakes―Whatever he may undertake, he succeeds in it.

content: 5. (=あながちそうとは限らない)not all; not always; not necessarily

content.content: あながちそうとは限らぬ
It is not necessarily so―That is not necessarily the case.
人は学問があるからとてあながち賢いとは限らぬ
A learned man is not always a wise man.
烏だとて皆々黒いとは限らぬ
Crows are not always black.
人は富貴に生まれたからとて必ずしも不幸だとは限らぬ
Because a man is born rich, it does not necessarily follow that he is unfortunate.
日本人だとて皆々勇敢とは限らぬ
Not all Japanese are brave.
光るものは皆々黄金とは限らぬ
“All is not gold that glitters.”

content: 6. (=そうでないとも限らぬ)not impossible; may possibly; might

content.content: そんなことは無いとも限らぬ
It is not impossible―quite possible―within the bounds of possibility.
この評判が本当でないとも限らぬ
The report may possibly be true―The report might be true.
戦争のことだから日本が負けないとも限らぬ
As it is the fortune of war, Japan may possibly be defeated―Japan might be defeated.

content:
かきわける〔掻き分ける〕
〈他動〉To push (people) aside; to shove (people) aside

content.content: 人込みをかき分けて進んだ
I pushed my way―elbowed my way―through the crowd.

かきん〔瑕瑾〕
〈名〉A blemish; a flaw; a fault; a defect

かく〔佳句〕

content.content: 佳句集
choice extracts

content.content: 各省に大臣を置く
Each department is placed under a minister.
彼は世界各国を漫遊した
He has travelled in all the countries of the world.

content:
かく〔廓〕
〈名〉A quarter

content.content: そこは別に一廓をなしている
The place forms a separate quarter.

content:
かく〔格〕
〈名〉
1. (=格式)standing; status; rank

content.content: 彼とは格が違う
He and I are of different rank.
学校の格を大学に上げる
to raise a school to a college status

content: 2. (=資格)character; capacity

content.content: 彼は今度は文士という格で現れた
He now appeared in the character of a writer―appeared as a writer.
彼は副使という格で一行に加盟した
He joined the party in the capacity of vice-ambassador―as vice-ambassador.

content: 3. (=規則)a rule

content.content: 格を守る
to adhere to the rule
格にはずれる
to deviate from the rule
彼の行為は格にはずれている
His action is irregular.
格を破る
to be an exception to the rule―exceptional

content: 4. (=文法の格)case

content.content: 主格
the nominative case
所有格
the possessive case
目的格
the objective case

content:
かく〔核〕
〈名〉The stone (of a peach); the nucleus (of a comet)

content.content: 彗星核
the nucleus of a comet

content:
かく〔角〕
〈名〉
1. (=角度)an angle

content.content: 直角
a right angle
鋭角
an acute angle
鈍角
an obtuse angle

content: 2. (=四角)a square:(=な) square

content.content: 角材
square timber
角な盆
a square tray
角に切る
to cut anything square

content: 3. (=将棋の角)the bishop

かく〔閣〕
〈名〉A hall; a palace; a pavilion

content:
かく〔隔〕
〈形〉Every other; every second; alternate

content.content: 隔日に
every other day―on alternate days
隔月に
every other month―in alternate months
隔行に書く
to write on every other line

content:
かく〔欠く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=端をこわす)to break off (the edge)

content.content: 茶碗を欠いた
I have broken off the edge of the cup.
小刀のさきを欠いた
I have broken off the point of my knife.
刀の刃を欠く
to nick the edge of a sword

content: 2. (=欠乏する)to want; to be wanting in (something); to lack; to be lacking in (something)

content.content: 彼は常識を欠いている
He is wanting in common sense.
この方法は精確を欠いている
The method lacks precision.
言行誠実を欠く
His words and deeds lack sincerity.
智有る者は往々徳において欠くるところあり
Men of genius are often found lacking in virtue.
彼は王侯に必要なる仁徳を欠いている
He lacks the virtues requisite to a ruler of men.
二人の間に意志疎通を欠いている
There is a misunderstanding between the two.
十冊の内一冊を欠く
Out of ten volumes, one is wanting.
事を欠く
to want for anything
俺が生きているうちは暮らしに欠くようなことはさせぬ
You shall not want for anything while I live.
彼は日々の生活にもことを欠いててる
He wants for the necessaries of life.

content: 3. (=無しにすます)to dispense with, do away with (anything); to do without, spare (anything)

content.content: 礼を欠く
to dispense with ceremony
忌中につき年始の礼を欠く
The family being in mourning, the New Year's ceremonies are dispensed with.
旅行中につき新年の礼を欠く
My absence from home on journey makes it impossible for me to offer my New Year's greetings.
語学研究には熟練は必要欠くべからず
In language-study, practice is not to be dispensed with―indispensable.
あるものにことを欠く
to do without what one has (at one's command)
あるものにことを欠いてフグを食うことはあるまい
Why should one eat the poisonous globe-fish when one has other good fish to eat?

content: 4. (=疎かにする)to neglect (one's duty); to fail in (one's duty)

content.content: 勤めを欠く
to neglect one's duty
義理を欠く
to fail in one's duty
これをしなければ役目を欠きます
If I omit to do this, I shall fail in my duty.
礼儀を欠く
to fail in propriety
孝道を欠く
to fail in one's filial duty
忠節を欠く
to fail in loyalty
約束を欠く
to break one's promise―miss one's appointment
暇を欠く
waste time―take time
たいそうお暇を欠かせました
I am sorry to have taken so much of your valuable time.

content:
かく〔斯く〕
〈副〉Thus; so:(形容詞に訳せば)such:(代名詞に訳せば)this

content.content: 彼の勉強かくの如し
Such is his diligence.
かく申すも老婆心
I say this out of kindness.
人は皆かくあらまほし
Such may all men be!
かくまで成功した者は少ない
Few men have succeeded to such an extent.
かくなる上はいかなることも辞さぬ
Now that things have come to this, I am ready to do anything.

content:
かく〔書く〕
〈他動〉
1. To write; to scribble; to pen

content.content: 筆で書く
to write with a brush
ペンで書く
to write with a pen―write with pen and ink
鉛筆で書く
to write with a pencil
鉛筆で書いてある
It is written in pencil.
赤インキで書いてある
It is written in red ink.
字を書く
to write
字が書けるか
Can you write?
この字をどう書くか
How do you make this character?
文章を書く
to write a composition
彼はなかなか文章を書く
He writes very well―He writes a very good style―He is very much of a writer.
彼は本を買いている、小説を書いている
He is writing a book―writing a novel.
英文の書ける人が欲しい
I want a man who writes English.
書くことが好きだ
I like to scribble.
白紙に書く
to write on paper
書く紙
paper to write on
書く筆
a brush to write with
白墨で黒板に書く
to write with chalk on the blackboard
ちゃんと顔に書いてある
It is written in very line of your face―depicted in every lineament of your countenance.
文はやりたし
I fain would write to one I love,
書く手は持たず
But that no hand to write I have.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 十ページ書いた
I have covered ten pages.
証文を書く
to sign a paper
彼は自分の姓名も書けぬ
He can not sign his own name.
手紙にこう書いてある
The letter runs as follows―reads as follows:―
本にそう書いてある
We read that in books―The book says so.
新聞に何が書いてあるか
What do the papers say?―What does it say in the papers?
この本は何が書いてあるか
What does the book treat of?―deal with?
僕は前置詞の用法の書いてある本が欲しい
I want a book treating of prepositions―a book dealing with prepositions―a treatise on prepositions.
書いた物がものを言う
It is down in black and white.

content:
かく〔掻く〕
〈他動〉
1. To scratch

content.content: かゆいところを掻く
to scratch where it itches
靴を隔ててかゆきを掻く(に相当するは)
I can not get at the exact meaning―I can not come at the exact truth.
身体を掻く
to scratch oneself
ボリボリ掻く
to scratch oneself audibly
頭を掻く
to scratch one's head
恥じて頭掻く(に相当するは)
to hang one's head for shame
耳を掻く
to pick one's ears
熊手で掻く
to rake
松葉を掻く(掻き集める)
to rake pine-needles together
火を掻く(掻き出す)
to rake out the fire―poke the fire
雪を掻く
to rake away the snow
水を掻く
to paddle
卵を掻く
to beat eggs
鶏が土を掻いて虫をあさる
A hen scratches for worms―scrapes for worms.
馬が前足で土を掻く
A horse paws the ground.
櫛で掻く
to comb
髪を掻く
to comb one's hair
髪を掻きなでる
to smoothe down one's hair
首を掻く
to cut off the enemy's head
寝首を掻く

〈名〉
1. (=心構え)expectation; preparedness; readiness; resolution; determination:(=する) to expect, look for (anything); to be prepared (for anything); to be ready (to do anything); to be resolved (to do anything); to be determined (to do anything)

content.content: それは覚悟の前だ
I am prepared for it.
なにごとがあろうと覚悟を決めている
Come what may, I am prepared for it.
万一の覚悟をしている(覚悟を決めている)
I am prepared for the worst.
医者は家族に万一の覚悟をさせる
The doctor prepares the family for the worst.
せんかた尽きて覚悟を決めた
Driven to my wits' end, I prepared to face the worst.
覚悟致せ
Prepare to die!―(西洋風に言うと)―Prepare to meet your God!
覚悟は好いか
Are you ready?
国家のためには命を捨てる覚悟だ
I am ready to lay down my life for my country.
命令一下直ちに出発の覚悟でおれ
Hold yourself in readiness to start at a moment's notice!
人はいつでも死ぬ覚悟でいるものだ
A man should always be prepared for death.
成功するものは悪口を言われるくらいは覚悟しておらなけりゃならぬ
A successful man must be prepared to have some dirt thrown at him.
死ぬ覚悟をした
I resolved to die―determined to die.
今度来る時は死ぬ覚悟で来い
The next time you come, make your will before you come.

I have come at the risk of my life―at the hazard of my life.

世の中へ出ると種々の苦労があるものと覚悟しなけりゃならぬ

それなら覚悟がある

content:
かくじつ〔確実〕
〈形〉Certain (fact); sure (way or method); secure (possession); assured (fact); safe (plan); positive (proof); authentic (news); true (aim); genuine (article); conclusive (evidence); convincing (proof); decisive (proof); definite (answer); reliable (source); trustworthy (quarter); sound (doctrine); solid (grounds); firm (basis); steadfast (friend); established (fact); giltedged, good (security, etc.):(=に) certainly; to a certainty; of a certainty; of a surety

content.content: これは確実な事実である
This is a certain fact―a positive fact―an established fact.
これは敵を亡ぼす確実なる方法である
This is a sure way of destroying enemies.
敵の要塞を確実に占領せり
We have taken secure possession of the enemy's fortress.
彼が無罪なことは確実だ
His innocence is certain―I am certain of his innocence―I am sure of his innocence―I am convinced of his innocence.
それは確実か
Is that certain?―Are you sure of it?
これは確実です
That is certain―I am certain of it―I am sure of it―I am positive of it.
これは大丈夫確実だ
That is a moral certainty.
この証拠は確実だ
The proof is positive―The proof is decisive―The proof is convincing―The evidence is conclusive.
確実な証拠
positive proof―decisive proof―convincing proof―conclusive evidence
確実な証人
a reliable witness―a trustworthy witness
朝日新聞は最も確実だ
The Asahi is the most reliable paper.
報道が確実だ
The paper gives reliable information―authentic news.
あれは確実な人間だ
He is a reliable man―a trustworthy man.
確実な理由があってこう言うのだ
I have solid grounds for saying so.
あの会社は基礎が確実だ
The company is on a sound basis―on a solid basis―on a firm basis.
確実な議論
a sound argument―a solid argument
確実な論法
sound reasoning
確実な説
a sound theory―an authentic statement
確実な教義
a sound doctrine
確実な品
a sound article―a genuine article
確実な約束
a positive promise
確実な返事
a definite answer
確実な狙い
true aim
彼の信用は確実だ、確実でない
His credit is sound―His credit is cracked.
警察で尋ねた方が確実だ
It would be safer to inquire at the police-station.
この話しは確実な筋から聞いた
I have heard the news from a trustworthy quarter―I have the news from a reliable source―I have the news on good authority.
確実な商会
a good firm
確実な担保
good security
確実な有価証券
gilt-edged securities
確実なことは知らぬ
I do not know for certain―know for a certainty.
確実にする
(報道なら)to confirm a report―(証拠なら)―corroborate evidence
この報道はまだ確実ならず
The report waits to be confirmed―wants to be confirmed―needs confirmation.
この証拠を確実ならしむる事実がある
There are some facts in corroboration of the evidence.
彼は確実に成功する
He will certainly succeed―He is certain to succeed―He is sure to succeed―He will succeed to a certainty.

content:

たいした学者じゃない

だいぶ学者肌がある

学者とは名ばかり

僕は学者をもって任じはせぬ

content:
かくす〔隠す〕
〈他動〉To hide (anything from a person); to conceal (a matter from a person); to screen (a place from the public gaze); to keep (a matter) from (one); to keep (a matter) secret from (one); to keep (something) back from (one); to secret (valuables); to cloak, mask, veil (one's motive); to cover up (a crime); to sink, suppress (a fact)

content.content: 人に物を隠す
to conceal a matter from a person―keep a matter from a person―keep the matter a secret from a person
もう隠しきれなくなった
I can't keep it from him any longer.
君にはなにも隠さない
I have no secret from you.
親に物を隠すものでない
You should have no secret from your parents.
(彼は悪いことして)隠そうともしない
He makes no attempt at concealment―makes no secret of the affair.
隠すどころかかえって自慢にしている
He makes no secret of the affair, but makes a boast of it rather.
彼はなにか隠しているに違いない
He must be concealing something―He must be keeping something back―There must be something behind.
彼は貧乏なことを人に隠そうとする
He tries to conceal his poverty from his friends.
ぼろを隠そうとしなけりゃ貧乏も辛くない
If you do not try to conceal your poverty, you will find it easy to bear―“Have the courage to appear poor, and you disarm poverty of its sting.”
人目を隠す
to screen a place from the public gaze
傘で顔を隠す
She hides her face behind her parasol―screens her face with her parasol.
悲しさ隠す笑い顔
She smiles to conceal her sorrow―conceals her sorrow under a smile.
姿を隠す
to disappear from view―vanish out of sight―(暫くなら)―keep out of sight―keep close―lie low
暫く姿を隠した方がよい
You had better keep close―lie low―for a time.
ほとぼりが冷めるまで姿を隠そう
I will keep out of sight till the storm blows over.
事実を隠す
to sink a fact―suppress a fact
商売を隠す
to sink one's shop
年を隠す
to conceal one's true age―suppress a part of one's age
猫は爪を隠す
A cat has velvet paws.
能ある鷹は爪を隠す
“Still waters run deep.”
爪を隠した悪口
feline amenities
隠せば罪深し
Concealment aggravates the crime.
何をか隠さん
I will be frank with you―be candid with you―be honest with you.
何を隠しましょう、妻は臨月です
To be frank with you, my wife is near her time.
色の白いのは七難隠す
A white complexion covers a multitude of sins.
頭隠して尻隠さず

包み隠さず言う
to say it out―tell the plain truth―make a clean breast of it
隠す事は顕われやすい
Murder will out.
隠した事が顕われた
The murder is out.
隠すより顕わるるは無し

〈名〉Decision; settlement; confirmation; corroboration:(=する) to decide upon (a matter); to fix (the date―upon the date); to agree upon (the terms); to appoint (the time); to settle (a matter); to confirm (a report); to corroborate (the evidence); to establish (a fact):(自動詞に用いれば)to be decided upon; to be fixed (upon); to become final; to become definite

content.content: 期日はまだ確定しない
